The restaurant is good but a bit pricey.  The staff, as you would expect, is very friendly and helpful.  Much to my surprise, the walls were a bit thin.  I could hear the laughter and toilet flushing in the next room.
Manager Response: Dear Dan834  Thank you for your feedback and your recent stay with us.  We will be sharing your feedback with your team.  We also hope to have you back with us in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Lovely Hotel with an outstanding staff.
Summary: Stayed at this hotel recently on a business trip. The rooms were very comfortable with a great pool and workout room. Close to shopping, too. But what really made my stay was Jada at the front desk. The night after I checked out (and after traveling to another city), I remembered I had left $100 in my room safe! I frantically called the Westin South Coast Plaza and got Jada on the phone. She said she would check and see if my $100 could be recovered. She called back an hour or so later and said my funds had been found. Then, because I couldn't return to pick up the cash, Jada said she would mail it to my home! This she did and I received the $100 a couple of days ago. Jada saved my vacation and is a wonderful person. Thanks, Jada, the Westin is lucky to have you on their team! I
Manager Response: Thank you for your review!  We are glad to hear that Jada made your stay memorable.  We will be sure to share your feedback with her.  We hope to see you next time you are in Costa Mesa!

Summary Heading: Subpar experience, not up to Westin standards
Summary: Subpar experience, not up to the Westin standard.  Room booked via SPG customer service was not as described, hotel staff offered nothing to accommodate including not offering to move rooms the 2nd night when rooms were available.  Amenities in the room were very limited and the rooms are quite dated.
Manager Response: Dear stace5677,  Thank you for recently staying at the Westin South Coast Plaza.  We would like to look in your concerns and ask that you contact the hotel and forward your original letter of confirmation so that we can review your requested room type.  We look forward to speaking to you soon.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: My daughter was celebrating her birthday and wanted to invite friends for a sleepover, what better place to bring 4 thirteen year olds. Nice pool, across the street from the mall, they all had a great time. To top it off they sent a birthday treat to our room for the birthday girl üòÉ
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are so glad you enjoyed your daughter's celebration.  We are happy to hear it was a success.  We hope to see you back with us again soon!

Summary: I stayed at The Westin last week for a business trip. The hotel is in a nice area. The hotel was very clean and I have always enjoyed my stays at Westin hotels. I ordered room service one night. The food was good but, like all room service, pricey. Even though I brought my own workout clothing, I appreciate that they offer Nee Balance gear for a small $5 fee so customers can pack lighter. All staff I encountered were very friendly and welcoming. Overall, I wouldn't hesitate to stay at this location the next time I return to Costa Mesa.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are so glad to hear you have enjoyed your stays at The Westin and found our staff has been friendly and welcoming. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back again soon!

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights.  Staff was mostly nice, rooms were average, and nice location in terms of being close to the mall.  The one major complaint I had was I wanted a quick bite, and I have a chronic illness that really limits the foods I can eat.  I went to the restaurant to ask to buy some cereal and milk (they did not sell it in their little store) and they wanted to charge me $24!  What, I could have bought 5 -6 boxes of cereal.  Then they told me it would have to come from room service and be delivered to my room.  Just what I wanted a $24 box of cereal and wait in my room on a sunny day for it to be delivered.  Parking was expensive too and restaurant was very understaffed.  Nice hotel but be prepared for them to nickel and dime you and a manager who does not care.
Manager Response: Dear TMaiden,  Thank you for recently staying at the Westin South Coast Plaza.  We apologize regarding the experience and will be sharing them with our Food and Beverage team for review.  We hope to have another opportunity to have you back with us in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: The Westin doesn't look too nice from the outside but the lobby, lobbybar and the rooms are extremely nice. The rooms are very large and very comfortable. The pool area on the second floor is huge and invites to relax. Very comfy pool beds and lounge furniture. The gym is okay but kind of small. Still good for a workout. The staff is very friendly, helpful and polite. The hotel is right across the street from the huge mall.  The only really annoying thing are the prices of the Starbucks in the hotel. Don't go there. They charge at least double. Either walk over to the mall or use the coffe in the room (free of charge). I enjoyed the stay a lot.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are so glad to hear you have enjoyed your stays at The Westin and found our staff has been friendly and welcoming. We are further glad you found your room comfortable.  We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back again soon!

Summary: I staid at theis hotel quite a few times for business. They are getting better!!! Amazing customer service. EVERYONE is helpful and genuine. Hotel is impeccably clean. Rooms are great. Gym is small but reall nice. Highly recommend!!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay with us and our staff was friendly and helpful. We hope to welcome you back again soon!

Summary Heading: Nice hotel for a stop off
Summary: Quality accommodation right across from the mall makes this an ideal stop off if you're a shopper.  Very nice rooms, lovely waterfall feature outside bar area & a decent sized pool.  Not many sunbeds though & it isn't as glamorous as it looks on the hotel photos. Sun Beds & pool area could do with a refurb. Phone for poolside service wasn't working too well the day we visited.  Self parking is $27 a night. Would recommend staying here though as it's so close to the mall and lots of dining options. Had a drink in the bar but it was the weekend and pretty quiet so lacked atmosphere.
Manager Response: Dear McAnnie1  Thank you for recently staying with us and we want to thank you for your feedback.  We will look into the concerns you pointed out but am glad to hear you ejoyed your stay with us.  We hope to see you back with us in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary Heading: Had to make 3 calls to get a noise complaint resolved
Summary: We were in the area for a four day water polo tournament and did not get to use the hotel for anything else but a place to shower and sleep. So, our main concern was a good night's sleep. On our third night (Saturday) the room next to us clearly had a lot of young people (well over 4 in the room) and we tried to be reasonable about the noise. At 11 p.m., we called down to complain. Someone came up, but did not make the people leave so the room still had a number of people in it. At 12 a.m., I called down again and turned on my air conditioner to try and drown out the noise. However, they only got louder and I called down again at 2 a.m. to complain and was annoyed that I had to call this many times at such a late hour. The next morning, the manager on duty, Matt Blankenship, did
Manager Response: Dear cuteesq,  Thank you for recently staying with us.  We want to apologize regarding your stay.  Someone from our hotel leadership team will be reaching out to you shortly.    Guest Relations Manager

Summary: I am a 1967 graduate of Orange High School, Orange, CA.  My wife and I traveled from Las Vegas, NV to Costa Mesa for the reunion.  This hotel is a gem.  Well appointed rooms, free wifi, mini fridge, coffee maker with Starbucks coffee, USB ports everywhere, even in the lamps, beautiful bathroom with a large walk-in shower, and NO resort fee,  The bed was very comfortable. We had drinks in the bar lounge area.  The drinks are overpriced, but the drinks, service and ambiance were stellar.  We had breakfast the following morning in the same lounge area.  Again, the breakfast was over priced, but very good.  Service and ambiance were stellar. The hotel also has a full size Starbucks with the hotel gift shop included within the Starbucks.  Nice touch. Always someone there to help you,
Manager Response: Dear RStringerSr  Thank you for taking your time and providing us with such great feedback.  We are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay with us during your High School Reunion and hope to have you back with us in the near future.   Guest Relations Manager

Summary: This hotel is a shining star in the industry.  They have delicious food, upgraded amenities, a caring staff and even a plush bed for my dog.  It's nice to find a pet friendly resort in an upscale chain like this.  Everyone from the bellboys to housekeeping went out of their way to make my stay a great experience.
Manager Response: Dear daffydi2014,  Thank you for your feedback. We are glad to hear your enjoyed our heavenly dog products as well as our staff.  We hope to have your back with us in the near future.    Guest Relations Manager

Summary: We stayed at this Westin and had a good experience overall. The staff are efficient and polite, the rooms are clean and well appointed, and the location is within walking distance of lots of shopping, restaurants and entertainment. The price was ok, a little high for parking and wifi. While our room was nice, it's wasn't soundproofed well and had a noisy fridge and a/c unit. Also, the window in the room was filthy so it ruined the park view we were given. Room service breakfast was very good.
Manager Response: Dear SBtravelgal,  Thank you for recently staying with us.  We appreciate the feedback and will be looking into your concerns.  We hope to have you back with us in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: Heavenly experience; extreme comfort! The queen bed was phenomenally comfortable, the duvet, pillows, and entire set up was heavenly! The room overall excellent, crisp clean, and service exceptional! The Westin is home away from home; healthy food choices and complimentary Starbucks coffee!
Manager Response: Dear SunnyCa98,  Thank you for providing such a great review!  We are very glad to hear you enjoyed our services and our signature amenities.  We are happy to be your "home away from home" and hope to see you back with us in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: One hour from LA this is a great place to relax and get away from the hustle and bustle. Beds are comfortplus. Modern fittings. Close to shopping. South Coast Plaza 5 minutes away with an acre of shops.
Manager Response: Dear garyjacobsen,  Thank you for staying at the Westin South Coast Plaza.  We are happy to hear you enjoyed your time and was able to get some time to relax and shop.  We hope to have you back in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: A good hotel that is conveniently located near South Coast Plaza and John Wayne Airport.  We booked two connecting rooms which were kept immaculate by the housekeeping staff. The room was spacious and the desk was installed with USB ports for charging which was immensely helpful for us. Rooms were clean and there was very little noise. The beds were very comfortable having slept in on many days. Complimentary Wi-Fi was included as part of the room offering. However, you were required to log in each day most likely due to security reasons. We were also happy to see no overcrowding issues in the main foyer.  The one good thing about this hotel is that the fitness centre is opened 24 hours. Many hotels don't make that concession and I was pleased to have used their facilities.
Manager Response: Dear Hung V,  Thank you for your feedback and for your stay with us.  We are glad to hear you enjoyed our location and your overall stay.  We will look into some of your concerns and hope to see you back with us in the near future.   Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Great location, nice option close to S. Coast Plaza
Summary: The hotel is located conveniently close to S. Coast Plaza mall. There is a connecting bridge that is much closer than i had thought. This bridge allows for easier access to more restaurants and shopping. The hotel provides many good amenities such as poolside dining, however we had just missed it as the operating hours are 11am-5pm. Please take note of these times as this is always key for me when i'm out of town. I would of given this hotel 5 stars, however the main issue being the smell of the room. Upon entry, the room smells like it had been a smoking room. We called guest services and were instructed to let the air conditioning cycle as the air in the room was "stagnant", however upon later return and even during checkout, we still could smell the scent of cigarettes. Not
Manager Response: Dear BrianNElaine  Thank you for recently staying with us and for taking your time to provide such a detailed review.  We are glad you enjoyed your overall stay but we will also look into some of your concerns.  We hope to have you back with us in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary Heading: Friendly service, convenient to John Wayne Airport
Summary: I stayed here for a business function.  Everyone on staff was very friendly.  Everywhere I turned, they were smiling and extremely helpful.  The food was good.  They had a nice variety and offered vegetarian options.  It is very close to John Wayne Airport and offers a free shuttle to/from the airport.  It is also in walking distance of a mall.  My room on the 16th floor was large.  The bed was comfortable.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Westin South Coast Plaza hotel hard to beat for your Orange County stays in Costa Mesa, Huntington Beach, Newport Beach, Santa Ana and Irvine. Great shopping across the street & Disney an easy trip. Easy Beach City navigation at CA-55 & I-405 intersection. Exceptional staff and superior property condition.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We enjoyed our stay in this nice hotel.  Our room was spacious, well-decorated, clean, bed was fantastic and service was excellent.  It was a nice, easy walk over a pedestrian bridge to the South Coast Mall where there were good food options.  Self-parking was easy but fairly expensive, typical of this area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed at this property before so this review is solely based on my most recent stay. The positives first: Great location, love Water Grill, proximity to South Coast Plaza and ease of access, close to John Wayne (SNA), and fairly quiet area.  Upon check in, printed letters at the desk advising of water shutdown overnight due to planned maintenance (scheduled for almost eight hours as I recall) for the last evening of my stay.  Although the letter suggested they would provide a couple of bottles of water, one would not be able to flush the toilet etc.  I view this unacceptable for a property at this level to have an outage of basic utility services for an extended period of time.  Had I been notified in advance, I would have made alternate arrangements.  I asked the
Manager Response: Dear ckccan  I first want to apologize regarding the inconvenience you experienced during your stay and from your feedback there are several concerns that I will be looking into.  As you may know from your past experience this is not typical of our service that we provide and I want to thank you for providing us an opportunity to make the changes.  Again we thank you for your feedback and appreciate your recent stay with us.    Guest Relations Manager

Summary: We stayed here for a girls weekend that centered around a theater production at the Sergerstrom Center for the Arts. It was a great location for our stay. We were able to easily walk to the theater to enjoy the play. South Coast Plaza is a short walk across the bridge for shopping and dining. The hotel is conveniently located just a few minutes drive from the airport. They also have a shuttle that transported my sister to the airport at the end of our stay. It was easy to drive to Balboa Island and Crystal Cove for activities during the day. The pool area was very quiet, relaxing, and well-taken care of.  Our room was clean and comfortable. We were able to get extra towels and bathrobes without a fuss. All of the staff we interacted with were friendly and professional. It was
Manager Response: none

Summary: My stay was very disappointing. The hotel is in a good location, but I experienced bad service and numerous problems.    Let's start with the check in process. There were several folks in line waiting and it was slow with only 2 people working the front desk. Then one of them left and never came back.  Thanks pal.    The room. The first thing you notice is how dirty the windows are. The fact that I even noticed tells you how bad it must be - so forget a nice view. I needed to charge my phone - the USB ports don't work.  There are also only two outlets in the entire room. Really ?  That's just ridiculous.   The walls must be pretty thin too. We heard lots of noise and conversations on both sides of us.   The TV. Worst guide ever. While you can scroll through it, it is slow and
Manager Response: Dear Joe-Bob-69  Thank you for recently staying at the Westin South Coast Plaza.  We are very disappointed to hear about your experiences.  I want apologize that we did not deliver the high level of service that we are known for. Please contact the hotel directly and ask for the Manager on Duty.  We would love to have an opportunity to speak to you.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Everything was wonderful except for quality of sleep
Summary: Great staff (particularly front desk and lobby cafe), clean rooms, good location.  Verbal recognition of Platinum status but no upgrade offered even though there were better rooms or rooms on higher floors.   Terrible sound/noise isolation. Could hear every car and motorcycle that passed by our 4th floor room all through the night. Worse yet heard every loud door slam and conversation in the hallway. Woke up about 20 times. I understand that the hotel cannot control noise or guest behavior but it can invest in proper soundproofing. There was a half inch gap at the bottom of our door.
Manager Response: Dear rlee508,  Thank you for taking your time and providing us with feedback.  I am glad you did enjoy our staff, cleanliness and location but am disappointed that your experienced was soured by the noise.  I will share your feedback with our team to see if we can make any adjustments.  We hope to have you back with us in the future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: Parking is close by for $20. I was not sure what to do when I come back in the afternoon.  I press the button again and get a new ticket.  By doing that, my parking ticket will not work the next morning.  I had to park my car, go to the front desk to fix it.  They should tell us how to do it when we check in.   It was annoying.    I am a platinum and I get $12 for continental breakfast- coffee, pastry, ... a set meal.  I went to the Starbuk and get coffee, sandwich $6, and something else using the breakfast coupon.  It is a better deal.    Close to the shopping mall
Manager Response: Dear Tom Y,  Thanking your for providing us with feedback.  To make some changes I will take your feedback and share with our team.  We hope to have you back with us in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Great location and very nice hotel
Summary: This hotel is across the street from a very upscale mall.  I've never seen so many elite stores all together in one place.  There are also some discount stores and a movie theater that are within walking distance of the hotel.  The hotel itself is lovely, rooms are good size, bathrooms are equally lovely, and the fitness center is well equipped.  The pool is also very nice.  I enjoyed my stay and would stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Jennifer W  Thank you for your great review.  We are glad to hear your enjoyed the location and the hotel itself.  We look forward to having you back with us in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Service was fabulous and at Christmas time - it's a special treat
Summary: I was at this venue for an event I was managing.  Besides the reputation of Westin and the Starwood brand, this property was centrally located for our clients that were attending our event.    The sales/catering team that I was working with was fabulous! From the first call once the contracts were signed to the day we were leaving and heading to the airport, they attention to details and customer experience was above average! And not just to me and my team as "their client" but to all the attendees to our event. There were several functions going on while we were there but you would never know that - our sales/event/catering team were on top of everything.   The food was delicious - several items people were going back for seconds ... and thirds.  The icing on the cake is that
Manager Response: Dear CMHCBB2011  We are glad you enjoyed your time here with us during your event and our Tree Lighting ceremony.  We appreciate such a great review and hope to have you back with us in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: This place is great. I come annually for a conference and each time I'm impressed by the space, how comfy the beds are, and how good the food is (for being hotel food). I stayed on the 12th floor and I slept like the dead with their blackout curtains. The 13th floor is their fancy floor if you can score good seats.
Manager Response: Dear evelilei,  Thank you for the 5 star review!  We are glad you enjoy your stay with us on your annual conferences.  We looking forward to your return next year.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Nice renovated hardware, not worth the money
Summary: This is a kind of standard business hotel. First of all, I would say this hotel definitely have spend effort on renovate its hardware, the restroom looks modern and it's clean and works OK, the water pressure is a little low at 14th floor though. The room is equipped with all modern features but the audio player is still use 3 generation old iPhone socket. The TV looks new but pretty dark and not able to change brightness from settings. The working desk is nice and has convenient connection.  The issue with this hotel is, they try to be a business trip type of hotel but does not have a club lounge, and they don't have a restaurant on site when I visit, the lounge has very limited selection of food.   On membership recognition, as a Platinum member, I got "upgraded" to spg member
Manager Response: Dear JojoLoveTravel  Thank you for taking your time and providing this feedback.  While I am glad to hear that you mostly enjoyed your stay I am disappointed that we were unable to keep your business.  We would love to speak to you directly, please contact the hotel and ask for the Director of Front Office. We hope to have an other opportunity to serve you in the future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: When landed (SNA), called for shuttle which arrived as indicated for a short drive to the hotel.  Hotel is located near to multiple restaurants and mall.  Service was excellent in shuttle and at checkin.  Room was very clean, view of pool and nice shower.  Ordered sandwich from room service, arrived quickly and was tasty.  Recommend this hotel for business.
Manager Response: Dear Ianplows,  We are glad you enjoyed your stay with us.  We thank you for the feedback and am glad to see you experienced all of our services.  We look forward to having you back with us in the near future.   Guest Relations Manager

Summary: This hotel is simply a lovely respite.  Location is very convenient to John Wayne Airport, South Coast Plaza Shopping, excellent restaurants and, my office building.    I visit a lot for work and often get stuck in a less optimal hotel.  I always breathe a sigh of relief when I realize I'm back at my Westin home.  Everyone is genuinely friendly and helpful.  The rooms are updated, designed well and feel spacious & welcoming.  The bed is comfy, there are convenient outlet locations to plug in all your electronics, a nicely-sized refrigerator for chilling drinks and leftover food.  The bathroom is also spacious with plenty of room to lay out toiletries.  Shower has good water pressure and the bathroom amenities are a high quality.    It's easy to sleep because the construction is
Manager Response: Dear Leah S,  We love to read reviews such as the one you took your time providing.  We are glad you were able to enjoy the location as well as the services during your stay.  We look forward to having your back with us in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: We stayed in a room with a murphy bed. We were supposed to be in a "park view room" but we switched last minute so we could use the room earlier. The hotel is right next to the mall, so that was very nice. Personally, we did not shop at a lot of the stores in the mall since many of them were high name brand, but the restaurants in the mall are really good. For "average priced" stores I recommend the Outlets at Orange. I believe it is about 20 minutes away so if you have a car I recommend you stop by!
Manager Response: Dear Hadleedd,  Thank you for your feedback and for recently staying with us.  We are glad to hear your enjoyed your stay and hope to see you back with us in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: I stayed two nights while I was in town for business. The room was very clean and extremely spacious. The shower was wonderful. If there was any drawback to my stay it would be the lack of choices on the menu with room service and in the restaurant. The food however will very good.  Location of the hotel was perfect. Very close to the highway so I could get where I needed to go.  Best part of this day that I was definitely the people that work there. Everyone is very friendly and seemed to be very genuine when they wished you a good day
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Hotel service the way it ought to be!
Summary: i want to recommend this hotel and staff without hesitation!! Every interaction was first class, and wonderful. Treat yourself to a stay here.  From Nick the valet at arrival, to Stacey at the front desk, you simply don't find nicer people or better service.  An earlier review mentioning cleanliness is absolutley correct, and the entire atmosphere of the hotel is wonderful. Kudos to the GM and the executive Housekeeper, and all the team.  Fom the  free newspapers in the morning, to the views from the very spacious roomroom, to the size of the pool, this is a first class operation. Treat yourself and a loved one to a stay here.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I am a very tidy person and value cleanliness, especially in a hotel. I have to say this is a super clean hotel. The hotel room had a king size bed and a sofa sitting area. It was architecturally designed to be spacious. It felt like it was bigger than it was. High ceilings and enough walking room. The bathroom and room in general was super clean. No dust and mysterious dead skin cells fuzz and dust all over the place if you touched anything. It was super clean and the valet guys are a riot and super funny. Conveniently located and next to the mall. Minutes to the local areas. I highly recommend this. There bed was comfortable, everything was clean and it was very quiet so I felt rested.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here for a few times now. We always have a good experience here and the latest last March was by far the best customer service we've got. I originally booked through a third party but for some reason my reservation was not on the record. This prompted frustrating long holds with the 3rd party ( expedia) who eventually told me to cancel the reservations. DO NOT BOOK WITH EXPEDIA. Special commendation to the manager on Feb 18 check in time around 4 pm ( I would have wriiten this review had I not made another less than a month at that time) who was very patient and helped me through the ordeal including the front desk who helped me finally check in.  Will definitely be back.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Stunning Accommodations during a Weekend at Disney
Summary: From the second we approached the main lobby, we were met with warmth and professionalism. Upon check in, Ramon was a stud. He asked if we were celebrating any type of occasion, and when i mentioned we were in town to visit Disney and that it was my wife's birthday, he went the extra mile. He put us in a corner room on a high floor with a courtyard view (Room was impeccable), provided us with some drink coupons, and offered his advice on Disney, a low cost shuttle service to and from the Hotel and late check out at our request. I travel a lot on business and a fair amount for pleasure, and this was the best reception experience I've ever received. Ramon deserves high praise for his dedication to the customer experience and intimate knowledge of his property and surrounding
Manager Response: none

Summary: I try to find something to support the title comment and the only thing I can say is, yes the location is excellent, being across the wau from a major shopping complex with ease of access and yes an array of great restaurants. It's a nice hotel, but I'm struggling to find more to say about the hotel, the pool is ok, the gym is barely ok, the location is excellent as I've said, teh room is very good but the bed and pillows are ordinary. Each to their own i guess....but then there's the dogs. Trust me I'm a dog owner but, hotels, really. Not my cup of tea and I will be looking for this options when I book again and I wont be booking where there are dogs. Trust me, in Australia, there are very very few dog friendly hotels and none of the 3-5 star hotels allow them (i am happy to be
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is really growing on me. We stay here when we're in the area to visit our daughter at college. The Westin is the nicest hotel in the area, in my opinion. The rooms are nice-sized and well-appointed. It's a quick walk over the pedestrian bridge to South Coast Plaza mall, which has a wide range of shops. It's just off the 405 which makes it easy to get around. The staff is great, particularly in the lounge/restaurant. Ask for Eladio if you're there for breakfast! He's friendly, and remembers us from visit to visit. You won't go wrong here!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Lovely hotel at South Coast Plaza
Summary: This hotel, located across the footbridge from South Coast Plaza is luxury itself.   My room on the sixth floor was spacious and comfortable, with a cloud-soft king-sized bed and pillows. The stylish bathroom had a walk in shower with a rain shower head and great water pressure.  The room came with a work desk, sofa, fridge, coffee maker, TV and free wifi.  Breakfast is not included but available in the Lobby Lounge or in the Grab-N-Go.  The lovely outdoor pool allows you to soak up the SoCal sun and relax.   There is valet and self-parking in a parking station nearby available.   I enjoyed my two nights here and it was a cool respite from all the shopping and freeway driving one does in the OC.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Westin South Coast Plaza does not disappoint! Let's break it down from start to finish. Check in was easy and the gal, Andrea, was friendly and helpful. As was the bell hop who was very helpful, kind and even said, "thank you for your business". This is a nice touch and he seemed genuinely happy to help. Up to the room...I was on the 14th floor. The room was clean, modern and large. The view was of the surrounding area. Nothing to great, but I did like that I could see the pool area. AND let's be honest...this is nothing like sleeping on a Westin bed...one of the best nights rest you will ever get is on a Westin bed.  The bar area was nice and the food was descent. Loved that they have a starbucks that opens at 6am right in the lobby. The hotel is super easy to get to as it
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed at this Westin for a three day conference.  Rooms were well appointed.  Not sure I care for the rain head on the shower, but I guess some people really like them.   Check in was slow with two clerks working four stations.  Throughout my stay whenever I needed to ask a question (there was no concierge) there was usually only one desk clerk working and therefore always a waiting line,   Not impressive service for an otherwise nice hotel.  The airport shuttle was prompt and courteous. The Fitness Center was small for a hotel this size, but it was not full the days I was there so i got by.  The equipment was all in good working order, which is not always the case even at nice hotels. I did not do any meal functions so cannot comment on the food.   There was no sundries shop,
Manager Response: Dear jsyverson  Thank you for recently staying with us.  We also appreciate you taking your time and providing such valuable feedback.  I am glad you did enjoy your stay with us and we will be looking into your concerns with staffing.  We hope to have you back with us in the near future.   Guest Relations Manager

Summary: This place is obviously newly renovated and it showed.  Please skip the restaurant in the lobby--truly a poor experience.  I stayed during a youth band concert and the elevators were frequently backed up with long waits, as was the Starbucks (there were so many White Mochas flying over the counter that I couldn't keep count).  The location of this hotel is excellent, but the best part was the front door staff and valet parking who were always alert, attentive, and very friendly.  Kudos to the front door team!

Summary: I am just finishing up my 3 night/3 day stay here.  I have enjoyed staying at this property for years and will probably stay again.  I say probably as one very important feature, to me anyway, was a problem again this trip.  That is the very dirty window in my room which is so bad this time I can barely see out at what would be a gorgeous 8th floor view.  Very disappointing.  I understand about the smog, dirt, dust of Orange County and all the rain this year.  But the windows need immediate attention!  Otherwise the service here is impeccable as always.  The room is big, clean, and comfortable and the valet parking is the best anywhere.  Wonderful attention was given to me at check in and I was even given a "welcome back" greeting.  However, I always try to get a higher room
Manager Response: none

Summary: They have definitely updated this hotel.  Modern rooms, happy, helpful staff.  It made for a great experience for the three days of the conference.  Good size room and comfortable bed.  Good size gym for workout, a bit sparse on floor space.
Manager Response: Dear bbqmaster69,  Thank you for the great feedback.  We are glad you enjoyed the gym and room while attending your conference.  We hope to have you back with us in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: Love this property!  The rooms are spacious, clean, and quiet.  The pool and deck are lovely.  The staff is courteous and attentive.  Special shout out to the guys at Valet and Stacey- always so kind!  This IS my go to place in the OC.
Manager Response: Dear JWJ1981,  We are very happy to hear that you loved your stay and our property!  Thank you providing such great feedback and we will be sure to share them with the team and Stacey.  We hope to see you back with us in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: Westins tend to be our go-to hotels for overnight trips, when we can use points or some combination of points and cash. The Westin South Coast Plaza benefits from a supremely central location, just across a small park from South Coast Repertory and the Segerstrom center for the Arts, and across the street from the massive, upscale shopping mall that lends the hotel its name. Rooms and beds are up to the usual high Westin standards, though the public areas lack the sophistication of sister hotels. The hotel's sole restaurant is best avoided; service can be indifferent, and the quality of the food not meriting the high price. Fortunately, a host of better alternatives are located a stone's throw away.
Manager Response: Dear Kirk E  Thank you for your feedback.  I will be sure to share with our teams and make some adjustements.  We are glad you did enjoy your stay with us and hope to see you back in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: foremost, mattress and linens were perfect so gets a solid 4 rating since that's my priority :) A few suggestions for hotel: 1) always include a ceramic mug option with room coffee makers. coffee in a paper cup is a little janky (unless you need to grab go, which we did not). 2) your "green" option to forego new linens and towels each day should not mean that you forego all housekeeping service that day (guests, read the fine print on this option). The room could still be tidied, bed made, coffee freshened, etc. 3) weird entry into hotel (basically front doors open directly into eating area and a very undersized registration desk is to the right. We're hoping soemthing was up and perhaps the hotel was remodeling somewhere so using the hotel lobby for food service. Otherwise,

Summary: I booked a junior suite with points and was told I would have a king bed at the time of my reservation. This is the first time in almost a decade that I never received what I requested nor has anyone ever told me I'm not guaranteed my room. Gene the manager was less than accommodating and rude. Find somewhere else to stay.
Manager Response: Dear dlopez57  Thank you for staying with us.  I was informed that you have been in contact with our Director of Front Office and am glad that he was able to make up for your issues experienced.  We are glad are enjoying your stay but please feel free to reach out to us if there is anything else we can do.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights in early March. The good thing about the hotel is that is it linked to the S Coast Plaza via a overbridge. besides that;   beds were very uncomfortable gym was v claustrophobic food was not good and overpriced in the restaurant poor wifi speed they charge $35 for parking!! Makes no sense in Costa Mesa.. Price is higher than other hotels nearby  I wont repeat this one when back. Sorry guys...
Manager Response: Dear VCG,  Thank you for recently staying with us.  I am disappointed to hear about your experiences.  I will make sure to share your feedback with our team.  I do hope we may have another opportunity to have you back with us in the future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: We had to stay here again for a conference and honestly, I was not enthusiastic after our last two stays over the last number of years.    I was pleasantly surprised!  The hotel rooms have been pleasantly updated and look wonderful.  Thankfully, the mini-bar has been replaced by a regular small (and quiet)fridge inside a cabinet.  The bathroom light/mirror was very nice as was the wonderful shower head.  As always, the linens in the bathroom and on the bed were very luxurious and comfortable.  There were 4 sets of towels in the bathroom, along with plenty of wonderful smelling soaps, shampoos, conditioners and body lotion.  Also, there was robe hanging on the bathroom door.    I like the heating/AC thermostat on the wall and quiet blower.  The doors from other rooms slamming,
Manager Response: Dear Splanky  Thank you for the great feedback.  We are glad you enjoyed your stay and we will be sure to share your feedback with our team.  We hope to see you back with us in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Good hotel for Irvine CA area -- need to improve check-in and beware the garage
Summary: Have stayed several times here recently.  Inevitably, the high stress moment is check-in.  Despite having made reservations, stayed recently on multiple times, somehow reception cannot manage to track your frequent flyer points.  This appears so incompetent as to be intentional.  I often spend 10-12 minutes, for what should be a 60 second process:  please give me my room keys.  I don't get it.  After you survive check-in, your fortunes will improve.  The sleep quality is quite good.  Bed is just right.   That's the key and got the four stars.  And the gym is nice, despite having aged treadmills.  Memo:  update treadmills.  (It was interesting in winter seeing the ducks swimming in the pool at 6am.  You've been warned.)  Dining downstairs is relatively pleasant with good service.
Manager Response: Dear FredTravelVa  Thank you for taking your time and providing us with valuable feedback.  We are glad you did enjoy the location and your stay.  We hope to have you back with us in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: Large business oriented hotel. Rooms are nicely renovated and front desk very nice. Had issues with room service. I ordered and was told 30 minutes. Got a call 35 minutes later saying it would be 15 more minutes. I called 25 minutes later and told it was on the way. Got it 1 hour after I ordered. Then I called for the tray to be picked up and went to gym. Returned from gym after an hour and tray still there. Not massive deal obviously, but did expect better service.   I like location and rooms are good. Fitness is decent. Expensive given massive technology demand for rooms, but for price hotel meets expectations though doesn't exceed them.
Manager Response: Dear FamilyNJTravel5  Thank you for recently staying with us.  I am glad you enjoyed our rooms and staff however we do want to apologize for your issues with room service.  I will be sharing this information with our Food and Beverage team to make sure your experience is not duplicated.  We do hope to see you back with us in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent! Best service I have ever received
Summary: I have reviewed many Starwood hotels in the past but by far, this hotel has the friendliest staff.  After arriving late on a Friday evening, Gene, at the front desk greeted us with a smile and he exhibited nothing but hospitality. I can't say enough about this guy.   He was genuine and it was not some phony "how are you doing today" small talk. My wife and I were blown away. Starwood- Westin, if you read these reviews, you really need more "Gene's" at your properties.  To other guests, ask for Gene. Even if he can't solve the issue for you, he will direct you to who can. The valet guys were nice, opening the door for guests and greeting everyone, I once went to the front desk to ask about parking and they were also friendly. There wasn't a single person that my wife and I
Manager Response: Dear Duke_Fairfax  Thank you for your feedback especially one that points out the great service that we provide.  I will be sure to share your feedback with the team and make sure Gene is recognized.  We hope to have you back with us in the near future!  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: I stayed at the Westin for a couple of days for business while in Orange County. Great front desk. I have celiac disease and they have a for real Gluten Free menu in the lobby restaurant. Make sure you let them know. Room was great. Wifi in lobby was good, in room wifi was stronger. They have a great waterfall patio, pool and sundeck I could see from my room but did not spend time at. The are 100yards away from the South Coast Repertory and just one more building away from the Performing Arts Center. Great access to both. South Coast Plaza is across the street, and Maestros Steak house is across the street a different way. Great location.  1 minor drawback. They do have a shuttle to/from the airport but in only runs every hour. I was expecting to catch it from the airport, but
Manager Response: Dear Tadman68  Thank you for your great review!  I am glad you enjoyed the hotel, it's amenities and our location. We hope to see you back with us in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: I returned to this hotel because, frankly, it's the best in the area. It's spotlessly clean. It convenient to restaurants and the freeway. Most importantly our room was quiet. Last time we stayed on the top (16th) floor. This time we checked in at midnight and the only corner (executive) room available was on the fifth floor. We had 511 which is a king, corner, all the necessary plugs for work, no connecting door, view of park and most importantly, quiet. Check in and out was fast. Complimentary wifi for SPG members was fast. Doormen and valet super efficient and friendly. Basically, a reliable 4-4.5 star for work or pleasure visit.
Manager Response: Dear ThuanMTran9  Thank you very much for your great review!  We appreciate your feedback and am glad to hear you enjoyed the hotel.  We are excited about your future return visit with us.    Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Very bad experience! The manager doesn't even care!
Summary: We arrived very late at night and they had only one room left. So they gave us this 2-bed room even if had requested a one bed room. The lady at the front desk said that as we arrived late there was nothing left!!  I am an SPG gold member and I didn't receive my upgrade as there was nothing left available so late.  Rooms are outdated and carpet a bit dirty. Westin's are supposed to be nice. This one is not!  Gym is really small, the air conditioner was not working properly, there was no water on the water machine and there are no mats for exercising on the floor...only a teared mat!   While checking out, We had a talk with the manager in order to express our disappointment... he only said "I am sorry".... and kept doing his work.   I have been an SPG member and loyal customer. I
Manager Response: Dear EZB_11  Thank you for recently staying at the Westin South Coast Plaza.  I apologize when you stayed with us you experienced several concerns with your room, staff and gym.  I will be sure to look into your feedback and will make sure we make the proper corrections.  We hope to have another opportunity to have you back in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary Heading: Eh. Stale, typical Westin with a lax staff.
Summary: First they couldn't find my reservation and were not in a big hurry to resolve it. Half hour later I finally got to my room. The manager did comp the cost of parking and WiFi (which in this day and age should be free anyway). In addition to the check in faux pas, the hotel is stale and average. They do have a nice pool and waterfall.
Manager Response: Dear Karliesjz  Thank you for recently staying at the Westin South Coast Plaza.  We appreciate you taking your time and providing us with feedback.  I apologize when you stayed you had concerns with the staff and hotel.  I will be sure to share your feedback with out team.  We hope to have you back with us in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Beautifully clean and kept, and amazing location
Summary: The location of this hotel is perfect.  Great central spot within walking distance to the mall across the street and a quick Uber ride to anywhere else you want to go.  I'm not sure how long ago the room renovations took place, but they are fantastic and beautiful.  A nice nice and soft color scheme.  If you are looking for a super comfortable "Westin Heavenly Bed" you've gone to the wrong place.  Same linens, which are great, but hard and uncomfortable mattresses.    There was also very little if any recognition of my SPG Gold status.  I was given a room on the 5th floor with 2 queen beds, when my preferences state "high floor, king".  I know these can't be guaranteed, but there was no mention about it during my check in, or no offer to give something else.  (so that part was a
Manager Response: none

Summary: I normally like Westin hotels.  This one is always understaffed at the front desk.  Not only do I always see a 5 to minute line at the reception desk BUT the quality of personal are under whelming. So the management does not know how to staff to make this a quality Westin hotel and they certainly don't know how to hire the right quality of staff.  I won't repeat
Manager Response: Dear Brad W  Thanking for recently staying at the Westin South Coast Plaza.  We are sorry to hear that you had to wait in line while checking in.  I will be sure to share your concerns with our leadership team.  We hope to have an opportunity to have you back with us in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: We spent one night at the Westin South Coast Plaza and were very impressed with the room. Amazing shower and seems to have been updated recently. It was raining so we didn't enjoy the pool area but the view of it from our room made it look like a great place to be when the sun's out. Parking was about $26 per night and wifi was extra also. We didn't check out much of the lobby or other areas since we were there a short time but what we saw was nice and clean.
Manager Response: Dear SLNeil,  Thank you for the great feedback.  We are glad you enjoyed your room and the hotel.  It is unfortunate that you were not able to enjoy our pool, we are sure it will be sunny on your next visit and hope to have you back with us in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Typical Westin -- Comfortable, OK restaurant, helpful staff. This one well located.
Summary: Westin's these days are upper middle grade hotels -- not luxurious, but clean, comfortable, well managed, good service attitudes.  The restaurant at this location is nothing special, but there are many good choices in the area, next door (excellent steak house) and at South Coast Plaza shopping center a short walk away.  One irritation at this and other Marriott hotels -- the take-away coffee shop (counter service) presents you with a bill that prominently asks for a tip. This is wrong for a take-away facility.  Why do they do this? Starbucks and other such places do not prominently ask for a tip on their bills. Does Marriott pay so poorly that the staff of a carry-out have to depend on tips?
Manager Response: Dear Edward B  Thank you for taking your time and providing us with feedback.  We are glad you enjoyed your time with us and I will make sure to share you concerns with our Food and Beverage team.  We hope to see you back with us in the future.   Guest Relations Manager

Summary: What I like about this hotel is the short distance to Irvine, Newport Beach and Costa Mesa but not having to pay the higher rates over the weekend. A great plus is they have a bridge that you can walk right over to South Coast Plaza without having to struggle to find parking if you drove.
Manager Response: Dear Ah-Lung  Thank you for recently staying with us.  We also appreciate you taking your time and providing us with feedback and am glad to hear you enjoyed your stay with us.  We hope to see you back with us in the near future.   Guest Relations Manager

Summary: Stayed here one night while in Orange County. The location of the hotel is great as it is very close to John Wayne airport; the hotel has a free shuttle to/from the airport. There are also a lot of restaurants a and shopping options in the close vicinity of the hotel.   The staff was super friendly and helpful and the rooms were great; as to be expected from a Westin property.  I will for sure stay here again in the future.
Manager Response: Dear Ryan F  Thank you for taking your time and providing us with such great feedback.  We are glad you enjoyed our location and your stay with us.  We are excited to hear that you will be back with us in the future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: Decent location about fifteen minutes from the airport and connected to a high end shopping mall and dining area by a ped bridge over the roadway.  The room was spacious, decent view outside, everything worked well.  It's either fairly new or has been renovated.  No tub in the bathroom (at least in mine), and no executive lounge in this property.  I didn't really spend much time in the hotel, enjoyed a glass of wine a couple of times at the bar.  It's a small but thoughtful list including some mid to higher end CA wines.  It was very busy but that never bothered me.  I did find it somewhat odd that a group of 15-20 people in their 20s congregated in the lobby on the couch and floor with a bunch of BYO booze.  It didn't bother me, but it was something I'd expect to see in a
Manager Response: Dear ckccan  Thank you for providing us with feedback.  We are glad you enjoyed your stay with us and we will share your feedback with our team.  We hope to see you back with us in the near future.   Guest Relations Manager

Summary: It was an amazing stay. Excellent service and really good location. There‚Äôs a bridge connecting the hotel to the South Coast Plaza, a really nice and fancy shopping mall. The room was really comfy, clean and functional (lots of USB docks for charging your devices).    Breakfast: was served in the bar. It looks kind of improvised / temporary. The food is really good and fresh. As a Platinum SPG Member I‚Äôve chose the complimentary continental breakfast (and for that I‚Äôve been credited $12 per person for a la carte breakfast). With $12 you can have juice and coffee. I think they should review this $12 value continental breakfast as credit.    Really nice fitness center and outdoor pool.    The valet parking ($32 per night) is really fast.    It was a really cool stay. Recommended.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Literally walk across the bridge to South Coast Plaza where you can dine and shop. It is right next to the repertory. Everyone was very pleasant the moment we got to the front door. The front desk personnel are very helpful and great personalities. Assisted me in printing some important documents. The hotel provided a dog bed and feeding bowls upon request.  Fee for parking either self or valet. Very clean as well.
Manager Response: Dear marion93722  Thank you for taking your time and providing us with such great feedback.  We are glad you enjoyed our hospitality and location.  I will make sure to share your feedback with our team and we hope to see you back in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary: Oh boy- this hotel is just lovely! The lobby is kind of small, but cozy with inviting decor.  The room has just enough space that make you feel like home and be comfortable!   Location, location, location! Walking distance (nice short walk! Seriously!!) to the South Coast Plaza where you can spend all your money! :p
Manager Response: Dear Da Y  Thank you for taking your time and providing us with such great feedback.  We are glad you enjoyed your room and our location.  We hope to see you back with us in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: For a three-day stint in LA, my friend and I stayed here because we were able to get a good rate (otherwise, it would have been outside our budget). Our room was extremely comfortable and spacious. We had breakfast in the restaurant each morning and were really happy with that. It offers a health menu selection and really lives up to the promise. We only had one poor experience due to a newer chef at lunch time that wasn't familiar with the menu and got out order wrong twice (which we still paid for). Having said that, the restaurant service staff were outstanding ‚Äì best I've experienced in my travels.  There were very noisy young people on our floor one night ‚Äì possibly there for a conference ‚Äì so if you're there for a holiday, it's worth knowing you're sharing the hotel with a
Manager Response: Dear lizgraetz  Thank you for taking your time and leaving such great feedback and we are glad you did enjoy your time here with us.  We will be sharing your concerns and recognition with our team.  We hope to see you back with us in the future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: Our party of 5 coming from Asia chose this hotel for its closeness to the South Coast Plaza Shopping Mall. We wanted to shop for a few days around New Year 2017 and we didn't have our own car. That part of our vacation went very well. The mall is a luxury mall and if you are willing to walk, there are discount stores and supermarkets near the mall that are open very late.  We saw the same staff people (front desk, bellmen, housekeeping, restaurant, and room service) on duty rather often. That was a good thing because that continuity resulted in polite, friendly, and considerate service.  They were well-trained because their services were smooth and usually prompt.  I was quite impressed by Mr. Love, the concierge there, who went out of his way to make sure that we had a good
Manager Response: Dear John P  Thank you for taking your time and providing us with such great feedback.  We are glad you enjoyed your time with us.  I will be sure to share your feedback regarding our staff and Gio Love with the team.  We hope to see you back with us in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel in a great location
Summary: Everything about the hotel was excellent.  Great service at check in.  The room itself was large, comfortable and quiet.  The room service was ridiculously high priced, but there is a Starbucks downstairs.
Manager Response: Dear Scott95401  Thank you for taking your time and providing us with feedback.  We are very happy to hear that your enjoyed our services and room.  We hope to see you back with us in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: The service was great.  Everyone was friendly and the checkin process was quick. The hotel (rooms) were renovated in 2015 so it looked and felt like a new hotel, very nice.  The rooms are spacious (Traditional room - king bed). The location is great.  South Coast Plaza is across the street.  There are a number of great restaurants around the hotel and easy freeway access.   Cons: - Internet is not available with every rate offered.  I think at this day and age internet access should always be included. - Valet parking fee is outrageous !!!!  it's US$ 27 for guests per night.  I understand the hotel is in a nicer area, but just think it's way too much for valet parking. - Dogs are allowed in the hotel.
Manager Response: Dear fabiotichy  Thank you for providing us with such great feedback.  We are glad you enjoyed the hotel and the location.  I will be sure to share your concerns with our team.  We hope to see you back with us in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: This is a typically well run up-to-date Westin property. If you know the brand, there should be no negative surprises staying here. Rooms are spacious, the beds are as usual fabulous, the bathrooms are rather small and nothing special. Lobby area is nice, with a full-service Starbucks on premises and a bar area with adequate seating. There's an outdoor heated pool I didn't use, but it seemed to be popular even in December. The location of the property is ideal since theres a short bridge right over to the impressive South Coast mall, as well as easy access to offices, theater, highways and the airport. Will definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Mike P  Thank you for taking your time and providing us with such great feedback.  We are glad you truly enjoyed our hotel and the amenities we offer.  We hope to have you back with us in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Very comfortable and location, location, location!
Summary: The room is spacious, clean and comfortable. The lobby bar doubles as the hotel restaurant and is very comfortable. You can sit on couches or in club chairs sipping cocktails and looking at the waterfall in back. The gym is adequate, very small but what seems to be new equipment and clean. Beware, you walk outside of the main hotel building, around the pool to get there so if it's winter, wear a sweatshirt! To get to South Coast Plaza there is a bridge over-crossing the main street. This mall is huge and has everything. Around the corner on Towne center Drive is a nice little pizza place, the gourmet pizza type, and loads of nice dining choices at the mall. BEST OF ALL - I forgot deodorant so I called the front desk and asked if there was somewhere in the hotel to get some. She
Manager Response: Dear WinoElkGrove_Ca  Thank you so much for taking your time and providing us with such great feedback.  We are glad you enjoyed the hotel and the amenities we provided, I be sure to share this with our team. We truly hope to see you back with us in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: Every year I am tasked with booking several rooms for a staff from our Las Vegas office to attend our annual Holiday Party.  For the last few years, I have booked the rooms at the Westin.  The help I receive from the Group Reservations Coordinator (Nana Cho, in particular) has made my job so much easier.  The rooms are lovely and modern and beds super comfy.  Everyone has complimented what a nice stay they had.  We also had a nice view of the giant Christmas Tree from our window which made the atmosphere all the much nicer and festive.  Would definitely recommend staying at the Westin South Coast which is so convenient to all the great restaurants, shopping, and Performing Arts in the surrounding area.
Manager Response: Dear harnold123,  Thank you for providing such great feedback.  We are glad you enjoyed your stay with us and we will be sure to pass on your feedback to Nana.  We hope to have you back with us in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Very good experience overall but no "specialness"
Summary: As with most Westins,nothing to criticize yet no real sense of intimacy or uniqueness. The lobby has all the elements needed ...bar ..place to eat.. Places to sit.. Yet nothing to particularly draw you to want to spend time there... Room is very nice although the shower is a bit difficult to operate.  Good location.. Can walk to south coast plaza and Water Grill restaurant is also. Easy access to freeways. Valet parking a bit pricey     Might come back but ideally would like a hotel that you want to hang out in longer
Manager Response: Dear RMillerLosAngeles,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  We are glad you did have some time to enjoy the hotel and the area.  I will make sure to share your concerns with our team.  We hope to have you back with us in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: This is definitely a 5 star hotel. From the friendly service,to the luxurious accommodations, you cant beat this hotel for comfort and class. Your choice of self or valet parking, with a walking bridge to the mall directly across the street. To top it off a beautiful Christmas tree in the center court. Wonderful holiday getaway.
Manager Response: Dear Ratcheeseman,  Thank you for taking your time and providing us with this 5 star feedback!  We are glad to hear you enjoyed our services and facility.  We want and hope to have you back with us in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary: I usually stay at this hotel purely based on its proximity to the shopping centre. It is a beautiful hotel and there has been some recent renovations which are nice.   As a business traveller inusually stay for 3 nights. I am disappointed the French restaurant they had there previously has been closed down with no replaycement put in place. The only option for dining is the food in the bar or to go across to the shopping centre which has a few options. When travelling for work I'm usually not to keen on leaving the hotel for meals so I find the choices really limited.  I had emailed ahead to request some large boxes be put aside for me to send some items back to Australia. I had received a reply from Robert to say this was fine. Upon checking in I followed up with the front desk
Manager Response: Dear Shannon G  Thank you for taking time to provide us with your feedback.  We currently are working on great restaurant option for the hotel and should have some wonderful news to share in the next few months.  I do want to apologize regarding your boxes we will make sure to share your feedback with our team to ensure your experience is not duplicated.    We hope to have you back with us in the future.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary Heading: Hits the Westin standard with room to spare
Summary: Great proximity to the mall (overpass connecting) and within walking vicinity to a number of restaurants and things to do.  Room service was standard - nothing to write home about here Room qualities were spacious, though the washrooms were smaller than I would have liked. Clean and relatively updated.  Swimming pool was well maintained and not too busy the times we visited.  All in all, a good stay as you'd expect from Westin

Summary: I've been happily spending Thanksgiving at this hotel for over three years now.  My family is far away so I look forward to Thanksgiving room service and a movie, then walking to the mall on Black Friday. They've updated the showers, but the rooms are getting old (but still nice, except for the filthy windows (there was also a dead bird on my 13th floor window ledge).  The room service this year was terrible.  Then menu hasn't changed in years and by the time my food arrived it was cool and my ordered-rare steak was well done. As seems to be the case in many hotels lately, the check out via tv did not work so I never got a bill (I called down). I'm re-evaluating my 2017 tradition to another hotel.

Summary: Stayed here for two nights over the Thanksgiving holiday and loved it! The rooms were clean, the food was delicious (including drinks), shuttle service to/from the airport was great and checkin-checkout was a breeze.  But what really set this hotel over the top for us was the true Westin customer service - the service here was top notch!  The shuttle drivers were so courteous and nice, check-in staff was helpful and very friendly, the room service delivery was above and beyond (when they forgot something the first round at breakfast they were quick to bring the missing item, along with an extra fancy coffee and side dishes - those last minute touches were so welcomed and appreciated!) - all of the staff (also the bartenders and cleaning crew!) went above and beyond with their
Manager Response: Dear Annette R  Thank you for your feedback and we are glad you enjoyed your holiday with us.  Our staff will be happy to hear the wonderful experiences you had during your stay.  We hope to have you back with us in the near future!  Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Superb, Elegant Hotel at a Great Rate
Summary: This Westin is beautiful. Perfect contemporary decor, an elegant lobby, beautifully-appointed, spacious rooms. This is a very good value. Did not eat here, but there is a Starbucks in the lobby (with breakfast food), which I love, so you're not "trapped" by the hotel's usually expensive and limited dining options. Pool deck is fabulous- warm, saltwater pool; tons of space and lounge chairs. I give this place a 10.
Manager Response: Dear NeverWork,  Thank you for taking your time and providing such great feedback.  We are glad to hear you really enjoyed the hotel and all the amenities that are offered.  We hope to see you back with us in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: Right off the 405 and a 15 minute drive to most business locations this is a road warriors go to spot. Very functional, no frills, no fuss, and none the worse for it. Water Grill restaurant next door is an OC staple and worth the steep prices. Talking of steep .. valet parking is $32 + tip.. sour taste. Breakfast also a disappointment for a hotel of this size. There is also. Functional decent sized pool which I did not use but it looked great. I usually stay at the Fairmont when in this bit of OC ( ie non coastal) but would now consider returning here. Plan B at least.

Summary Heading: We finally found our "go to" place
Summary: We travel very often to the Costa Mesa area.  My wife attends a lot of trade shows that are held at the Orange County Fairgrounds throughout the year.  We have tried many hotels in the Costa Mesa area during these many visits and they were basically "hit or miss", mostly "misses".  Well, we finally found a true "hit".  From now on, The Westin South Coast Plaza will be our "go to" place for all the many times we find ourselves in the Costa Mesa area.  This hotel is second to none.  They have the friendliest staff of any property in Orange County and wonderful facilities.  We loved our room, truly a "home away from home", and the pool was amazing.  I would like to compliment the entire staff at The Westin South Coast Plaza, and assure all of you that we will surely be coming back
Manager Response: Dear JEFF_K_1963,  A true WOW.  Thank you for your great feedback and.  I will be sure to share this with our hotel team.  We are glad you really enjoyed hotel and consider us a "home away from home".  We look forward to having you back with us in the near future.    Guest Relations Manager

Summary: Among the better managed westin properties. Stable staff who promptly do what they can to help accommodate patrons. Near multiple local notable restaurants and shops.   Across a short walking bridge from Seasons, Capital Grill, Vaca and a host of notable cuisines. Walking distance from Vons market. Multiple performing arts centers within a few minutes walk. Samuel I & Sedgerstrom among them.   Breakfast outside by waterfall recommended
Manager Response: Dear RMJ11  Thank you for taking your time to provide such positive feedback.  We are glad you enjoyed the staff and the location of the hotel.  We hope to have you back with us in the near future.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Beautiful Hotel, but eat and park elsewhere.
Summary: My wife and I stayed here for a weekend.  It is set in a beautiful location in Costa Mesa.  The Avenue of the Arts is just a gorgeous area to walk around in. And the hotel itself is very nice and upscale.  The service is great and the common areas, beautiful.  The rooms were spacious and we did have a great view from our windows.  Typical great Westin bedding and linens.  Reliable and quick Wifi, large LCD TV with tons of channels.  And all around an upscale feel. I only had a couple issues at this hotel that left a bad taste in my mouth.  The first was the parking.  Self parking in the lot across the street was $27 per day in a mostly empty lot, which seems a bit stiff for a non dense city area.  And secondly, I told the front desk that I would like breakfast as my SPG platinum
Manager Response: Dear foodnwine2522  Thank you for taking your time to provide us with valuable feedback.   I will be passing the information you provided to our team to make some corrections.  In the future we hope to have another opportunity to have you back at our hotel.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: An organization that I worked with held a conference there.  Rooms and meeting space --well planned and laid out.  Breakfast and catered food was terrible and the restaurant inside the hotel is limited.
Manager Response: Dear F6734TDkevinc  Thank you for your feedback.  We are glad you enjoyed our rooms and meeting space during your conference.  We will share your feedback regarding food and restaurant to our food and beverage teams.  We hope to see you next time you are in the area.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: Everyone there was great and helpful, so why the average rating?  Well, first of all, I was there for a grueling conference and the food there is really pretty bad.  One evening I was so burned out I really would have loved to just lounge and order room service, but I take exception to a hotel telling me at every turn that I have to be healthy.  It's annoying.  The first day we had lunch at the bar and the burger comes on a wheat bun without even mentioning it on the menu.  That burger was extremely dry and nearly inedible, then they serve it with fries!!  Really??  I had the crab and avocado salad which is one of my favorite combos.  It was pretty flavorless.  So disappointing!
Manager Response: Dear Rachaele30  Thank you for your feedback.  We take pride in everything that we do, I will make sure your feedback is forwarded to our Food and Beverage team.  On your next visit we look forward to having you back with us.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: Returning to Westin South Coast for long weekend stay in early October. Since I‚Äôve been here before, I knew generally what to expect and as a Platinum Starwood member, I email the hotel in advance to see about an early check in and upgraded room. I was very happy that they were able to give me both.   The hotel is very close to SNA airport and very convenient to the 405 freeway and across the street from South Coast Plaza. This mall is very upscale and gigantic with lots of dining options. Din Tai Fung restaurant is very famous and known for their dim sum, but no reservations. Best bet is go right before they open. Also there is Boudin, known for their authentic SF sourdough bread.    The hotel is being renovated and I was on the SPG floor (14th floor) which requires card access
Manager Response: Dear SusieJue  Thank you for your feedback.  We appreciate the time you took to post this review.  I will be sharing your review with our team.  We hope that we may have another opportunity to serve you again.    Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Location is excellent and the hotel was as expected
Summary: This hotel is nice for its location but lacks from the other Westin's I have been to. Perhaps its the big entry or something but it did not strike me as an SPG level 5 hotel. The elevators seem old and the hallways are dated. Overall is a good hotel but not fancy.
Manager Response: Dear Maria L  Thank you for your feedback.   Next time you are in the area we hope to have another opportunity to have you back with us.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Everything is just like you expect at an aging Westin
Summary: Average. That's the best word that I can descibe this slowly aging hotel. The gal at check in was very good and polite. We were able to get our room at 11 am. Valet had very good service. But the rooms were just what you would expect at an aging Westin. Yes, of course they have been remodeled, but the A/C unit was loud and could not keep up with the humidity from the coastal fog. The bed was fine, but it may be time for another linen change out. And forget about eating at the hotel lobby for breakfast unless you want to spend $45.00 for two people. Rip off. It has a good location if you want to go to South Coast Plaza or the offices in the area. But otherwise, there are better choices.
Manager Response: Dear laplume9254,   Thank you for keeping us informed of how your stay was. We truly appreciate the feedback. We hope we get another opportunity to take care of you at our hotel.   Guest Relations Manager

Summary: Definitely my favourite Westin!  Great facilities and the rooms are well appointed and spacious. The ambiance is modern yet warm. Close to chopping and 10 minutes from the ocean. Staff are outstanding!

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel in a Green Surrounding.
Summary: WESTIN, one of my favourite brands of SPG  little-bit disappointed me while I stayed here at South Coast Plaza, Costa Mesa. Indeed, it was a beautiful hotel in a good green surrounding. A huge shopping mall is just steps away while Costa Mesa Airport is also closed by. Indeed, it is a business hotel.  We had no plan to stay here but, while passing through, the hotel impressed me and I decided to stay here at-least  for a day or couple of days. Finally, I made the booking and checked-in the hotel. My overall stay experience was good.     I do remember and appreciate the friendly behaviour and appreciated service of Mr. NICK LUCIAN who tried his best to make our stay memorable by honouring my Platinum Status. He kindly upgrade my room and given a good suite in the top floor.

Summary Heading: This is a class , true 4 Star htel just accross the street from the world famous South Coast Plaza Mall.
Summary: This is really one of the best quality hotels I have stayed in. The rooms are updated , fresh, and roomy. This is an upscale hotel, which is in the process of adding a new upscale restaurant. When that is completed next year this should become a 4 1/2 star property! They have a wonderful staff at the hotel, which makes you feel welcome and appreciated. The hotel is very close to John Wayne Airport (SNA) and the hotel provides a shuttle to and from the airport. They offer self parking and Valet parking ( both with a fee). We had a family celebration , and all of the family stayed a the hotel. It was perfect in every way.
Manager Response: Dear R G B, Thank you so much for staying with us. It sounds like we hit the target on your experience. Thank you for sharing the special details that made it memorable. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: I stayed here with my girlfriend to attend a concert at the Verizon Amphitheater. It's perfectly situated right off the freeway and across the street from South Coast Plaza.  We spent the day at the pool. There were two other families there, so it was nice that it was pretty empty.  We waited a while for someone to come by and take our drink and food order, but no one came. We then saw a phone on the other side of the pool that you can use to place an order.  The drinks and food were good, I had the chicken tacos that were pretty filling even though it only came with two.  The rooms were very clean and updated.  They do charge for parking, i believe $20 for self park and $25 for valet (ridiculous). Overall, a very pleasant stay and would likely stay here again if I'm in the area.

I personally really liked the pillows on the bed (I know everyone has their own varied pillow preferences, but I thought these were fantastic!). The pool area was nice on a warm day as well. Self-parking is $27/day, as mentioned in other posts. I was a little put off by this fact at first, but after our wonderful experience with the staff, I didn't even mind paying so much for parking. The staff was the absolute best part of our experience. After arriving back to our room very late the evening of the

If you just enter the parking structure and pay for a day its $20.00 , seems a bit like a rip-off if you ask me. Friendly staff and a nice clean open lobby with a bar. If I was in the area I like this location and proximity to South Coast Plaza was a big draw. I was told this hotel has good value disney packages .... for a future trip

Summary Heading: Great place to sleep and feel at home.
