Summary: Stayed here for 2 nights for a nearby business meeting.  Previously stayed here 5 years ago.  Rooms are clean and fit the Westin standard, but appeared a bit dated.  Bathrooms are ok, a bit run down.  No double Heavenly shower heads, just a flexible shower head and a fixed shower rain setup.  Faucet was still pouring water when shower was engaged so had to report problem to Front Desk which promptly resolved the issue by the evening.  Odd that no Shower Gel was provided as part of the toiletry kit!  Had catered breakfast which was delicious.  Bar ambience is pleasant.  Gym well equipped but the only complaint is you have to walk outdoors from the hotel building to get to it so in January it can be cold out early in the morning! Proximity to South Coast Plaza for shopping and
Manager Response: Dear GeeTee54321,  Thank you for providing feedback regarding to your visit.  We are delighted to hear that you had a pleasant stay.  We appreciate your recommendations on improvement.  We look forward to your return on your next stay. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: The Westin South Coast Plaza offered a great experience. The wi-fi was spotty in service. Valet service was great! Within walking distance to the  South Coast Plaza Mall.  There were no plug in for devices, had to plug in phone in bathroom.
Manager Response: Dear Janis K,  Thank you for your feedback regarding your stay.  Our valued associates appreciate your feedback. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: Stayed for three nights while attending a conference. The hotel is pretty standard. The lobby bar was nice - there is an impressive waterfall feature just outside the bar with terrace seating. I would have enjoyed this more if it wasn't raining the whole trip. Ditto for the pool - looked nice but didn't get to enjoy it. There is a small park next to the hotel and the hotel is situated next to the Orange County Performing Arts Center. As for entertainment, there is a walking bridge to South Coast Plaza, one of the largest upscale malls I have ever seen. There are over 30 restaurants so we had plenty ofmoptions while visiting. I would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Matt S,  We are glad you enjoyed your visit with us.  We hope you will be back soon. Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Good hotel for in and out of SNA
Summary: Location is nice for in and out of Orange County but I wouldn't stay for extended period of time here.   Overall property is nice, clean and comfortable, staff friendly and attentive. Made me feel very welcomed from start to finish.  Passed on valet, parking structure is a little walk if you choose self park. Room was upgraded to massive parlor suite, fairly clean but HVAC seemed to pump out a lot of dust in my bedroom so I used HVAC in parlor and turned bedroom unit off. Could use more detailed cleaning and straightening on a daily basis. The furniture was crooked and things just not put back in place. This is a hard act to follow seeing that I just came form The Montage Resort for 2 nights.....  Gym looked nice as did pool but I was out early next morning so I didn't use plus
Manager Response: Dear 2worldtravele,  We are delighted to hear that you felt our team looked after you when you were here.  Our team takes pride in taking care of our valued guests.  We look forward to your return visit. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: On a business trip service is important and this Westin is lacking.  Constant WiFi problems, and I was given phone number to call -- remote -- little help.  Antiquated cables in rooms.  No plugs for devices.  Confusing in-room amenities.  With a little upgrade these rooms could be more functional.   Pleasant but not helpful responses from the front desk, even the supervisor.  I guess it starts with management and apparently something here is lacking.  Actually, I'm a little surprised, since this is a Westin and I came for a conference.
Manager Response: Dear doctoryes,  We appreciate your feedback.  My apologies we were not able to deliver on your business needs when you were with us.  We strive to deliver an experience for our guests that allows them to reach their potential.  We will continue to work on business solutions that are seamless for our guests.   Guest Relations Manager

Summary: The best in "The OC"!  Gorgeous, modern, clean rooms, wonderful service, and South Coast Plaza is just across the convenient walk-way. All the high-end shopping (and wonderful restaurants) close at hand.   Love it!  I would never stay anywhere else when in Orange County.
Manager Response: Dear Adelle I,  Thank you so much for staying with us.  We look forward to your return visit.   Guest Relations Manager.

Summary: This is a bare bones Westin.  It is located close to the 405 which makes it easy to get to other neighborhoods and locations.  It is also right next to South Coast Plaza Mall not that I am a shopper but it is handy for a forgotten item or two. There are two Starbucks within walking distance, one is in the mall just inside the entrance on the left.  The other is down the street and around the corner near Quiznos.  Since Wi-fi is free at Starbucks and not at hotel,  I opted for Starbucks where I can get a free refill with my registered card.  The hotel does have a Westin on the Go in the lobby that sells Starbucks coffee, bakery items, yogurt and fruit.  But, Starbucks opens at 6:30am and Westin on the go at 7:00am.  Obviously, no complimentary coffee in the lobby.  They do serve
Manager Response: Dear nycgirl20,  We appreciate your feedback on your experience with us.  Our team strives to deliver memorable experiences to our valued guest.  We will continue to work hard to make those connections with our guests and hope that we are given another opportunity to provide you with the service experience you expect from Westin. Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Decent hotel for a short stay
Summary: Stayed here for 2 nights whilst in LA with my wife as we got a good web deal.  The room was good and we had a view over the pool which was nice.  The facilities (pool and gym) were also good.  The issue with the hotel is that there isn't much that a traveller would want to do within walking distance so that means you really need a car.  My biggest issue with the hotel was the cost of parking, which ended up costing us about $30 a night extra, which is not unusual but still rich.  This could have been a little cheaper had we opted for the self-parking option but when we arrived at the hotel it wasn't clear that this was available.
Manager Response: Dear PeterJForster,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us at The Westin South Coast Plaza.  We hope you will make a return visit to our hotel when you are in the area again. Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Not up to the usual Westin/Starwood standards
Summary: There are so many longer and more detailed reports here I will just keep this simple:  * After staying away from this property for two years and staying exclusively at the Irvine Hyatt down the road I broke down and tried the Westin SCP again. (So, no Mr. CS Manager I will not give you another chance). * I am Starwood Platinum and Hyatt Diamond.  I am not flashing those as badges but am pointing this out just to say that I know good hotels and I know bad hotels.  This is a bad Westin and is mediocre in the grand scheme of things. * Internet speeds are all over the map and on the first day completely unusable. * DOGS!  I know this hotel is marketed as "pet friendly" but it is ridiculous!  We passed 8 or 9 dogs just heading to/from our room and out the door of the lobby. * DOGS!
Manager Response: Dear Gary H,  My sincere apologies for your experience.  Your feedback is extremely important to us and we appreciate you letting us know how we failed to deliver on your experience. We will do everything in our power to make this right.  We do accept dogs and it is not our policy to allow them in our dining areas.  We will revisit this policy with our team members to ensure it is followed consistently.   Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, but not star quality
Summary: Spent one night before a trip to Mexico, and what can I say. Nice but not a great room, the best qualities are its proximity to South Coast Plaza, the South Coast Repertory, and Performing Arts Center. Close to John Wayne (Orange County) airport. No free wifi, but if gotten on a discount a nice place to stay. Not a destination hotel, though.
Manager Response: Dear Qualnurse,  Thank you for your feedback regarding your visit.  We are glad to hear that our location met all your needs.  We strive to deliver on experiences for our guest.  We hope you will give our hotel another opportunity to deliver on your expectations. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: We  stayed here for one night when we were attending a performance at the Performing Arts Complex which is right next door. The location was great, from the hotel there is a bridge walkway straight across to the Plaza stores across the road. Very convenient. The staff are nice as you would expect from an exclusive hotel. The decor was beautiful. The bar was nice and served food that came out quickly. The drawback is that the staff are so sterilised they lose some of that genuine warmth that smaller hotels have.The room we had looked out across the pool and gym and was nicely appointed.  There was a bit of noise from adjoining rooms of children being noisy or throwing something or other. Not very well soundproofed. Maybe they dont expect much noise. Very nice though.
Manager Response: Dear AustraliaAust,  Thank you so much for your feedback.  We are glad that you felt the property met your needs.  We will share your feedback regarding the staff with our team to ensure we can improve on your expectations. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: I‚Äôve spent over 20 nights in this facade of a luxury hotel over the last 5 years and I can say that the experience has been consistent. Consistently mediorce. (This is a follow-up review from Dec. 2010)  The staff is always friendly and helpful, the location is excellent (right off of the 405 and adjacent to the swanky South Coast Plaza mall, numerous corporate headquarters and many outstandng restaurants like Charlie Palmers, Scott‚Äôs, Marche Moderne, etc.) and the grounds are nicely landscaped. But this is a mirage.  The belly of the beast reveals a thoroughly average, dated hotel with dull rooms (even though they were recently upgraded), a lifelesss pool area with no shade and an apathetic attitude for thier best customers- like me.  As a Platinum level guest, I would have
Manager Response: Dear dupedtourist,  Our sincere apologies that you felt the hotel has not been able to deliver on your expectations as a valued Starwood Preferred Platinum member.  We value your loyalty and strive to exceed your expectation.  We hope that you will give us another opportunity to provide you with a stay that will help you reach your potential and leave a lasting impression.   Guest Relations Manager

Summary: We stay here often and always appreciate the clean rooms and beautiful facility. Everyone that works there seem to be pleasant and helpful. Pool is small but nice...we didn't  use it this trip, but have in the past. Love the skywalk to the mall!
Manager Response: Dear Mamthgrl,  Thank you so much for staying with us.  We are excited to hear that you loved your stay.  Look forward to your return visit. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: Location: Adjacent to the South Coast Plaza Mall, and conveniently located off the Freeway with relatively short driving distances to almost anywhere in Orange County and the beaches.   Laguna Beach was my favorite.   Parking:  Vale and self parking . Charges apply.  Check in and Check out: At check in they had difficulty in accessing  my reservation made through a website, but they were extremely polite all the time I waited there. When checking out they could not print out my bill -computer issue they said, and said they would email it to me which they did the same day. Staff at check out though was not as extremely polite as the check in crew. Maybe it was because it was 4 am in the morning.  Room: Upper floor room with nice view. Comfy bed and pillows. Large flat screen, HD
Manager Response: Dear Ural_74,  Thank you for your feedback.  We hope you will give our hotel another opportunity to meet your needs upon your travels to our area. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: April at the front desk always checks my associate and me in with a smile and remembers all our preferences - I seriously don't think she's capable of frowning.  The entire staff is friendly at this, location which is almost as important to us road warriors as the rooms.  Large rooms and close by shopping/food make this an ideal location - still trying to get used to the new shower heads, but that's all Westins, not just this one (I miss the heavenly dual shower heads)
Manager Response: Dear GrantP2,  Thank you so much for mentioning one of our valued associates. She will be glad to know that she made an emotional connection with you.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Bad service, no help staff to be found. All in hiding!!!
Summary: Rooms are large and clean!!! Bathroom is average. Nothing special.  The gym and pool are clean and equip.  Valet car service is excellent but it will cost you $28.00 per day plus an additional $2-5 for tip.  Hotel is extremely dog and pet friendly.  Also very kid friendly. Kids running around everywhere.  Entrance is decorated beautifully but the glass doors are filthy with hand and finger prints, all I could see where living germs screaming at me. Same thing with the elevator buttons. It's sooo easy to wipe these type of things down. And it makes a huge difference visually and also mentally.  The quick and grab is the only place you can get the food and service you need.  The lobby bar service is horrible. Not helpful and again not enough staff.  I watch several tables get up
Manager Response: Dear jadebynikolai,  Thank you for your feedback regarding to your experience with us.  Our sincere apologies that we did not deliver on your experience when with us.  We hope that you will give us another opportunity to provide you with the type of service you expect from The Westin brand.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: After a 2 year self imposed sabbatical from business travel, I turned up at the Westin, like I had never been away (minus a few bazillion points). The high quality standards are all there, if not better than I remember and I was greeted at the front desk as if I was still one of the family.  The food from the restaurant was really very good and the staff could not have been more helpful.
Manager Response: Dear Jorton,  Thank you for sharing your experience with us.  Our team will be glad to hear that they made you feel welcome and that you were treated as a valued frequent traveler.  Look forward to seeing you on your next visit. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: Seriously dated Westin that provides below expectations.  Pros: - Clean Rooms - Free wifi - Good location - Comfortable beds   Cons: - Circa 1985 and well used in need of a major overhaul - They got rid of the great Westin shower heads and replaced w/ low flow - No Starwood benefits - no club floor, etc.   - Kind of smelly
Manager Response: Dear amy e,  Thank you for your feedback regarding to your experience with us.  Our apologies that you felt we missed the mark for your visit.  We strive to deliver experiences that help our guest feel renewed.  We hope that you will give our hotel another opportunity on your next visit to the area. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: I always like staying at a Westin Hotel...always have fabulous beds and I sleep well.  This is only about 10 minutes from the airport and they have a complimentary shuttle bus which is handy. The room is spacious and bathroom is a good size.  The meeting rooms are good too. I would go back!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Sometimes you just find a chain of hotels that you like, for me they are Starwood properties and Westin is usually my favorite, this weekend was no exception.  We stayed at the Westin in Costa Mesa, the staff were very friendly, the room was nice and the chain has a signature smell that is pumped through out the hotel.. thus, it smell like a Westin.    The property is located just a bridge walk away from shopping and pretty good dining.  I would say, worth a stay if you need to be close to John Wayne airport in Orange County
Manager Response: Dear NotGreatSte,  Thank you for letting us know that you like the Signature Westin sensory experience.  We hope to see you on your next visit. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: We only stayed the one night and this hotel met our expectations of a Westin. The room was clean and well equipped with their normal very comfortable bed. The location is great if you love shopping as you can walk across a bridge to the shopping centre for shops and restaurants. The only hotel amenity we sampled was the restaurant. We were a bit disappointed as it didn't open until 8am and advertised a buffet breakfast. The food was very good and we enjoyed it but it wasn't buffet style as one ordered everything off a menu.  Overall a very nice stay.
Manager Response: Dear wcroyal,  Thank you for choosing us for your one night visit with us.  Thank you for your feedback regarding our restaurant.  We will share your comments and hope you will return to our destination on your next visit. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: I was very impressed with this hotel. The service from the staff was excellent. The rooms were very comfortable and generously appointed. The bed was quie comfortable. The restaurant was excellent. The lobby is rather elegant. The location to South Coast and the local attractions is quite convenient. I highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Vincent M Thank you for letting us know that we met all your expectations upon your recent visit.  Our staff takes pride in delivering on our guest experiences.  Great to hear that they did just that.  Look forward to seeing you on your next visit with us.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: The Westin South Coast Plaza is in a great location to go other places in Orange County easily.  The beds are comfortable, as are the rooms in general.  The carpeting in the rooms needs to be replaced - ours was a bit shabby and dirty - but the functionality of the rooms is good and it is a fairly quiet location.  The gym is good and the restaurant, Pinot Provence, in the hotel is very good.  I felt it was a good value.
Manager Response: Dear Charlotte S,  We are delighted to hear that you felt the hotel was in a great location for your visit.  We look forward to your return visit.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: Check was very smooth and the staff was very knowledgeable and helpful. The room was another story. We were there for a holiday party so it was just over night no big deal, but for $140.00 plus $10.00 for parking this is what you get: Mold in the shower - yes I said mold and not just a littel that can be over seen by a cleaning crew but we almost though it was suppose to be green grout that was falling  out. Broken sink - the plug for the sink was broken so in order for water to drain out of the sink you had to remove the plug, its that classy. Then while puting on my shoes I happen to glance at the bed on the other side of the room and there was trash, not under it but just on the edge of the bed. Then to top off all this the so called clean bed... how come we found HAIR on the
Manager Response: Dear AAArmijo,  Thank you for your feedback regarding your stay.  We take your comments very serious and can assure you that we will continue to maintain our guest rooms to the highest level of cleanliness and maintenance that is expected of our valued guest.  We hope that you will give us another opportunity to provide you with The Westin experience.   Guest Relations Manager

Summary: Our family went to spend the weekend to celebrate our daughter's birthday.  She was turning 3, and we were having a party at a restaurant near the area.  When we checked in, we mentioned that it was her birthday.  The staff gave her a birthday cake, and a card signed by the entire staff.  WOW.  So thoughtful.    It really made her day.  She was really happy.  The fact that they took the time to sign the card meant a lot.    The only thing I don't like about the hotel is the over $30 parking fee.  :-)
Manager Response: Dear IVsystem,  Thank you for sharing your feedback regarding a memorable moment you had with us.  We look forward to your return stay. Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Very nice basic room, good location
Summary: As always, I have to preface this by saying I got a great rate through Priceline. The downside is that they charge $20 a night for parking. Even with that extra charge, it was a good deal.  The room is pretty basic, but it was very clean and the carpet felt great under my bare feet. The beds, though definitely not queen size, were very comfortable. (I didn't bother trying to ask for a single king). The bathroom is small and basic, but it too was very clean. The shower has an awesome dual head system and the bath robe was a nice touch (would have been nice to have two).  Our room was on the 8th floor facing away from the 405 freeway. As a result, we had a relaxing view of the park below. Speaking of the 405, the hotel is in a great location for freeway access. It is across the
Manager Response: Dear thedlr,  Thank you for your feedback.  We truly appreciate understanding how you felt when staying with us.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary: This is our second stay here in the last couple of years. It is a good all-round hotel. Great bed, and they change the sheets every day, quite a large and well-maintained room, decent service (especially on the front desk) and a nice bar area. You can get Starbucks coffee and basics downstairs. Bathrooms need remodelling, but they are clean and adequate. The public areas are very well-kept, and the gym is large and with a number of machines. It faces the pool, which is a nice change from facing a wall.  If you are having a "shopping holiday" as we were, this can't be beat. Short walk to South Coast Plaza - world's best mall - and some good restaurants. Capital Grille is a seriously good restaurant. You can also walk to theatre (South Coast Repertory), and other stores such as
Manager Response: Dear teachers_on,  Thank you for sharing your experience with us.  We value your feedback and how you felt when staying with us.  We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed the rooms and felt our hotel was very clean.  We hope to see you on your next visit. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: Just a short walk to a beautiful mall with plenty of stores and restaurants.  Self parking is somewhat inconvenient since its off to the side.  Hotel staff was very helpful and service was great.  There's a beautiful waterfall just outside the bar area. If not busy it's a great area to relax.  I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Copper07,  Thank you for letting us know you felt the staff was friendly and helpful.  Our team dedicates themself to providing the best service.  We hope to see you on your next visit. Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Multiple stays here & it's always on point
Summary: I'm a fan of Westin hotels in general but this one is always on point. I stayed here Feb 2011 and found the room beautiful & comfortable, and always like the toiletries in the bathroom. I was there for a conference being held in the Orange County Performing Arts Center and there is literally no more convenient hotel than this one, just a 4 min walk across a courtyard. I ate at the bar as well as in the restaurant and was impressed with both. I paid $532 for 3 nights.   This year I stayed again in Feb (2012) and was given a "junior suite" which was actually two rooms connected - one was a traditional bedroom for my roommate and I and the other connecting bedroom had been converted to a comfortable living room with 2 couches, chairs and coffee table! It was awesome to have two
Manager Response: Dear seg110, Thank you for your loyalty to The Westin brand.  Our team works diligently to make connections with our guests and I am glad to hear that you feel our team is on point when you visit. Look forward to your return.

Summary Heading: Room rates looked good...but add $ for eveything extra!!!!
Summary: This looked like a nice hotel, we planned to stay there for 2 nights to explore the area. It was clean, comfy but you had to pay for parking each night, then they wanted $12 per day for the use of the internet. The internet charge is outrageous in this day and age, I can go to McDonalds or Starbucks, and I am sure plenty of other locations for free internet. In our 21 day trip through Washington, Oregon and California, I am sorry, yes it was nice, but it had the least (included)amenities of all the places that we stayed. The bed was extremely comfortable though!
Manager Response: Dear jeno66,  Thank you for your feedback.  We are glad to hear that you chose our hotel for your travels.  We continue to strive to take our guest feedback and make changes that can help our guests reach their potential when with us.  Thank you for sharing. Guest Relations Manager.

Summary Heading: A Slice of Heaven in Irvine
Summary: I had a late check-in and the night staff were nothing but helpful. I was in Irvine for KCON and was exhausted from being out all day. The desk personnel helped us find a restaurant close by and the room was nothing but exquisite.  The beds were soft and even though the bathroom did seem a bit bland considering the room, I enjoyed the room! I couldn't thank the front desk enough for the help they gave us. I am planning on coming to Irvine again in November and will definitely keep The Westin on my list of options.
Manager Response: Dear Indn05,  We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your guest room.  We look forward to your return visit when you are in Orange County again. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: The only reason I cannot give this hotel 5 stars is because the food is just slightly below the quality and flavor I normally experience at even lower starred hotels.  We had a 3 day workshop here at the hotel. The meting space is great, but the best part is the staff. Everyone including the PSAV staff, Banquet Manager (Gustavo is excellent!), banquet servers, and front desk staff have far exceeded my expectations.  I am a corporate meeting planner for a large company. We put on about 12 workshops per year here in U.S so I am very familiar with Marriotts, Hyatts, and Westin's on this level. Even slightly off service can really put a huge kink in our workshop. I have never had to look for anyone when I have needed something, there is always someone right there when I need them.
Manager Response: Dear Avery B,  We truly appreciate your feedback regarding your experience.  It is great to hear that you felt our team was at your service and ready to make you rmeeting experience the best possible.  We look forward to your return.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: A great location, just across from the world-famous South Coast Plaza shopping center, the Westin in Costa Mesa delivered a wonderful stay. I have visited numerous Starwood properties, and every time the service is great. Easy check-in, courteous service, and a wonderful location.  I arrived into town quite early, and thus needed to check-in earlier. The hotel was more than able to facilitate my early arrival, as well as upgrade my room to a higher floor, which provided a wonderful view. (I loved walking into my room at night and seeing the city lights below).   The hotel partakes in a green environment program which I was glad to see. If you decline fresh towels, you get a $5 voucher, each morning,  good towards food at participating hotel eateries. So, if you dont need fresh
Manager Response: Jordan N,  Thank you so much for your positive feedback regarding to your experience at our hotel.  We are glad that you felt recognized when you arrived and that we made your stay memorable.   Guest Relations Manager.

Summary: Excellent location. Right off the freeway and a short walk away from the south coast plaza mall which has stores ranging from sears to Louis V. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Bathrooms are out dated but overall a great hotel and value.
Manager Response: Dear sbd610,  We are delighted to hear that our hotel met all your needs when you visited.  We look forward to your return.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: Nice hotel in an excellent location. Close to excellent shopping and restaurants within walking distance. Very close to airport as well. Rooms were nice, but the bathroom needed remodeling. Tile was cracked and out-of-date. Beds were comfortable, and the pool and fitness center are very nice. If you forget your gym clothes, don't fret! For $5, the hotel will provide you with workout clothes and tennis shoes!
Manager Response: Dear airgirl6,  Thank you for your feedback.  Our new Gear Lending Program with New Balance is a great option to have when traveling.  We hope you will come visit us again on your next visit. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: Working toward Platinum status is work and takes committment but consider it an investment! Starwood and in particular this Westin makes the effort to make the hard work worth the effort. On check-in, we received an upgrade to an available suite, gorgeous! I asked the Westin front desk directions to Ralph Brennan's Jazz Kitchen¬Æ  at Disney Downtown, not only did they offer to make our reservations when we arrived the restaurant knew who we were, that the Westin set us up and to our surprise, Westin sent to our table a special appetizer treat, on them!  Thanks Westin South Coast for a memorable experience!
Manager Response: Dear CapitalWarrior,  We value your loyalty to Westin and Starwood.  It sounds like your travels keep you very busy and reward you with the elite Platinum status.  It is a pleasure to hear about your experience with our staff taking care of all your needs and creating a special moment for you.  We look forward to your return visit.

Summary: What a disaster!  This place is for boring business travelers.  I have sent this same set of complaints to the Manager of the hotel, as well.  My card was charged four times for our stay.  I was charged the incorrect rate for our stay.  Housekeeping did not refresh the coffee, cream, cups, stirs, lids, holders, etc., in the room, nor did they change the pillowcases when the sheets were changed.  There was one robe for two people.  We were there for my husbands birthday and it was not acknowledged.  The staff could not be less helpful or tedious.  The valet turned on the running lights and burnt the covers.  This place was so stiff and boring.  The descriptions of the food on the lounge menu are incorrect; If you order lettuce, you get cabbage.  We left and went to the Ritz.
Manager Response: Dear GIRLZEUS,  Thank you for your feedback.  We truly appreciate your opinion on how you felt when staying with us.  We will continue to educate our team on the experiences that our guest inform us about when we fall short of your needs.  We strive to provide service that is memorable and delivers on the Westin brand promise.  We hope that you will give us another opportunity to exceed your expectation. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: My class reunion was at this hotel.  The hotel is perfectly located to the South Coast Plaza mall, a Segerstrom Performaing Arts Center and numerous restaurants.  This is not a new hotel but the rooms are large, well appointed, and the beds are extremely comfortable. Parking is $20 per day for self-parking.
Manager Response: Dear ibaol,  Thank you for letting us know that you felt our rooms are spacious and comfortable.  It is so important to feel at your best when traveling.  We look forward to your return. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: The property is older but the amenities are nice. The bed is comfortable and the rooms are large and comfortable. However, you can tell this property is older and for the price - you could gay at a newer nicer property. Basically you're paying for location.
Manager Response: Dear Imleyva_MBA,  Thank you for your feedback.  Our team strives to maintain our property to the fullest.  We are deligent in providing a product that is fresh and delivering on experiences that are memorable.  We hope to see you on your next stay. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: The Westin South Coast is a beautiful Hote.  The staff was first class for check in, the room was clean.  My problem was 2 doors down, there was a BARKING DOG!  Yes, I said Barking Dog.  After many calls to the front desk, Nothing was ever done.  It was very rude of the guest to leave the dog alone all day for everyone on the floor to enjoy.  The Hotel staff was not helpful in keeping or stopping the dog from barking.  Never did they ask if I wanted to change rooms or care about my concern.  So next time you check in, please make sure you are on the NO DOG side.
Manager Response: Dear 50thbirthday4,  Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent visit.  My sincere apologies that you were disturbed during your stay.  We are dedicated to providing an environment that all of our guests can thrive.  We hope that you will give us another opportunity to provide you the service you deserve at Westin.   Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: It's a Westin, of course it's good
Summary: I don't often get to stay at Westin's, but when I do I have always been happy. This one has so many pluses for me. The footbridge takes you across to South Coast Plaza and to one of my favorite smaller chain restaurants, Season's 52. Scott's Restaurant is right outside of the lobby (a local favorite of mine), and Morton's and Nordstrom Rack are all within walking distance.   I mention walking because you don't really need a car, and at $20 for self park, and $28 for valet (which is crazy expensive even for this area) you are better off walking.  Top score for me? The fitness room. Almost brand new treadmills and ellipticals, as well as a nice view of the pool. I only ate one night in the lobby bar and the chicken quesadilla was in a whole wheat tortilla with proper pico and guac
Manager Response: Dear Steve_N_018,  Thank you for your feedback.  At Westin, we truly believe in our guest wellness.  I am glad you were able to renew yourself while with us.  We look forward to your return. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: I appreciate how fast the check in was considering I had a really long day at work then a 5 hour flight before arriving at the hotel.  My cousin asked for an adaptor and was given a complimentary one right away.  Food from room service was good and brought to our room fast.   Very clean, large rooms and pretty lobby area.  I appreciate the power strip on the vanity table anticipating needs of techie travelers.  Definitely recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear kait1yn,  Our team understands the committment to making life easier for the busy business traveler.  It is nice to see that our team made your travel experience simple and seamless.  Thank you for staying with us and we look forward to your return. Guest Relation Manager

Summary: My husband & I attended my friend's wedding reception held at The Westin & had reserved a room for convenience. We had several delays en route to the hotel & I had called ahead to advise them of our late arrival. Staff was awesome and assured our room would not be given away. We finally arrived in the wee hours of the morning & they upgraded our room to the 14th floor. Very clean, large rooms/bathroom. Lots of restaurant choices within a mile if you decide you don't want room service. Great mall right next door, right off the 405 & has a decent pool. Starbucks right downstairs was a huge plus. Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Tina E,  We are glad that you had a memorable visit when staying with us.  It is great to hear that our team was able to exceed your expectations during your hectic travels.  We look forward to you returning.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Inspired to write review while still staying at Westin
Summary: Best Westin I've ever stayed at and one of the best hotels in general. I took advantage of a 20% prepay special and the value is quite remarkable. Very large rooms, immaculate, airy, sparkling clean bathroom, double-head shower, tons of towels. Lovely lobby area with a gorgeous waterfall in the central courtyard area. So much fun to watch a wedding take place there. Excellent, generous gym overlooking the pool. Easy walkway over to the mall. My room overlooks a small park by the Performance Arts Center--ask for that view when you come. Friendly staff. I'm here on business; a treat to sit by the pool working on my computer. I just wish upscale hotels like these wouldn't feel compelled to charge for Internet access ($11.95 for the day).
Manager Response: Dear MelsmomNe,  Thank you for letting us know that you felt our hotel exceeded your expectations for the Westin experience.  Having the ability to relax and be in control of your stay is key to travel.  It is nice that we helped to provide a renewing moment for you while you did your business at our hotel.  Look forward to your return.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: The Westin looks better from the outside than from the inside. The rooms are just average, everything looks a bit old. Try to get a room on the side of the Performance Arts Center, or you'll hear the freeway day and night. Still, the hotel staff is very nice and friendly, you can open the window a bit to get real air and the location is (depending on what you want) very practical. You can walk from the hotel over a bridge to the best mall in CA, the South Coast Plaza with all its upscale shops. The self parking is not so expensive and the internet is cheap. They come sometimes in package for 25$ a day. The location next to the freeway makes the Westin ideally located to reach from there Irvine, Orange, the beaches, or even Disneyland in 15-20 min.
Manager Response: Dear RaduZaciu,  Thank you for your feedback on your recent stay.  Our team enjoys delivering experiences that are welcoming and help our guests' to reach their potential.  We hope that your travels bring you to our hotel in the future.   Guest Relations Manager

Summary: We chose The Westin because it offered great rates, was close to family, and easy driving distance to Disney and beaches. The rooms were incredibly comfortable, the staff first-rate and, as luck would have it, the hotel is right across the street from an enormous mall. There's even a pedestrian bridge from the park in front of the hotel to the mall! Color me happy. Parking was convenient, just across a quiet street to the garage. Close to good restaurants, too.
Manager Response: Dear MazeyHunt,  It is great to hear that you felt The Signature Westin Heavenly Bed helped you rest in comfort.  Our location is truly in the center of it all.  We hope to see you on your next visit. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: luxury, great rooms, great pool and gym. great service. location is more businesslike than fun, but who cares. If you want to stay in a real upscale hotel ....try this one and tyou won't be disappointed.
Manager Response: Dear mvm1,  We are delighted to hear that you felt the experience met all your needs.  We look forward to having you back with us when you are in the Orange County area.   Guest Relation Manager

Summary: Having arrived at this property late at night, it was a quick stop in the self parking parkade located adjacent to the hotel before walking over to the hotel. At $20/night it's almost the norm for overnight parking now but this time it's on the 5th floor of the parkade. Be prepared for a little jaunt across the street.  Efficient check-in and friendly staff had me up in my room within minutes of arrival.  Comfortable room with clean bathroom and lots of amenities.  The bathtub can get a little slippery (because it's so clean!?) so watch out or be sure to use the provided rubber mat.  Maybe it's just my PP but, even though I'm sure it feels good, the days of the dual Heavenly Showerhead are gone. Like the old gas guzzler cars of the 70's they were great when they came out with
Manager Response: Dear LongWayAcr Thank you so much for your feedback regarding the friendly team we have and how clean our guest rooms are.  Our team takes pride in offering the best product in Orange County.  We look forward to your return visit. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: We spent a nice weekend in this hotel.  Everything was great, the bed is wonderful the sheets were nice, the towels were huge, the robe was nice.  THE STAFF WAS EXCEPTIONAL. Great location.  Cant complain a thing.  Highly recommend.
Manager Response: Dear Jilie D,  It is great to hear that you felt our staff was great.  We will make sure we share your comments with our team.  We look forward to seeing you again. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: The Westin Costa Mesa is a typical Westin property with the room updates and lobby views common to all 90's turned Heavenly redos.   I was happy with the large room sizes, but while te decor is not dated, it is starting to show its age in worn areas.   The location is the best part of this property.
Manager Response: Dear willbw02,  Thank you for your recent stay.  Great to hear that you felt our location was key to your visit.  Look forward to your return visit.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: Overall had a very pleasant stay!  Noticed the first night that my bed spread was on inside out and wasn't changed during the entire length of my stay.  Luckily I know I'm clean so I wasn't entirely bothered by this, but it did seem odd after the second night when I clearly took part of the cheet off in hopes it would be fixed or changed, no such luck.  As others have mentioned, bathrooms need updating, wifi is only included if you stay on the top floors otherwise you have to pay which seemed like a rip off for the Westin, and the parking garage is a quick walk across the street which seems a little sketchy late at night.  Would be great if there was direct/covered access.  Overall though a pleasant experience!  Hotel is in good proximity to some great restaurants, so there's
Manager Response: Dear Nancy P,  Thank you for staying with us.  We appreciate your feedback.  We hope to see you on your next visit. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: After a long business trip the Westin delivers again. I went out of my way to stay at our favorite note. Like before we chose not to stay at competing chains such as Hiltons or others because, well, Westin is just the best when it comes to caring for their clients and customers. I rested assured that all would be taken care of.   The front desk receptionist, Brianna, took care of everything and made sure that my accommodations were acceptable.   Thanks Westin!
Manager Response: Dear Matt S.,  Thank you so much for taking time to share your experience at our hotel.  We will make sure that Brianna is recognized for making an impact while you stayed with us.  It means a lot to hear that you felt our associates made you feel cared for.  We look forward to seeing you on your next visit.   Guest Relations Manager

Summary: The good things: 1) Westin's Heavenly Bed--fantastic; 2) great service all the way around, from the front desk to the maids to the bartender who makes a great Mojito, the entire staff is attentive and helpful; 3) the Starbucks on the main floor is a full Starbucks serving the full menu, a great way to get the day started and right in the hotel.  The great things: 1) right across from the hotel's main entrance is a lovely park, an oasis in the midst of busy Costa Mesa; 2) beyond the park is the footbridge which takes you directly to one of the nicest shopping areas in all of Orange County, South Coast Plaza; 3) contained within the mall is a host of great restaurants, including The Capital Grille, Claim Jumper, Maggiano's, Morton's Steaks, Scott's Seafood, and many others.  The
Manager Response: Dear WalnutBaron,  Thank you for choosing our hotel for your oasis.  Our team takes pride in providing memorable service to all of our guests and it appears they continued to keep that alive based on your feedback.  Thank you so much for staying with us.   Guest Relations Manager

Summary: Stayed here for business travel.  It was a solid stay, clean rooms, nice pool area and very convenient.    My co worker had consistent issues with her room key. The bathrooms are highly outdated and need a renovation!  Room service is ridiculously expensive, you're better off going across the street to a nice restaurant at the mall for what you end up paying.
Manager Response: Dear kkf114,  We appreciate your feedback regarding your recent stay.  We strive to deliver experiences for our guest that help them reach their potential.  We hope you will give us another opportunity to exceed your expectations.   Guest Relations Manager

Summary: The Westin is a modern, friendly type of hotel. The room was nicely furnished, the public spaces in the lobby area offer lots of quiet seating, and the pool area was well serviced by the F&B staff.  Eating at the hotel seemed more difficult than it should have been, and I got the impression the nearby shopping mall offered too much competition with so many restaurants.   But if you have business in the area, it is a good option, and the staff made the stay very pleasant.
Manager Response: Dear JJFlash138,  I am glad to hear that we made your visit accommodating and you felt our staff was friendly.  We will share your experiences with the restaurant to ensure we can meet your expectation next time.  Look forward to your return visit.   Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Great for shopping and if you want to be close to different things
Summary: We stayed at the Westin for five days. The hotel room was very nice. Upside is also the pool area which is great for kids to play but also for relaxing.  We liked that Costa Mesa is very central and its only around 20 Min. to Disney plus also the beaches. There's lots of shopping in walking distance. A great but very, very fancy mall. If you look for all this choose the hotel. Price was worth it.   Downside: They would like to be 5* but service wise they are far away from that. Especially their french restaurant is a place to keep away from. Sunday Breakfast is Brunch - but without buffet. They serve orange juice without asking but bill it afterwards. Our written comment was not followed upon.  So: Yep, we'd go back but breakfast at the mall and dinners somewhere else.
Manager Response: Dear Usach,  Thank you so much for choosing our hotel for your recent visit.  We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed the location and shopping.  We apologize that the restaurant did not meet your needs.  We strive to provide spectacular service.  We will share your comments regarding your experience so we can improve upon our service levels and offerings.   Guest Relations Manager

Summary: I will start with the positive this hotel has to offer. The Hotel property and the Hotel itself is lovely, the d√©cor is wonderful and the property overall is clean and kept in great condition. The negative side of this property is that they charge their guest 20.00 a night to park in the parking garage, internet cost 6.00 for 10 minutes then another 6.00 thereafter, what a rip off! The prices at the Hotel bar and restaurant is of course overpriced, but I guess that is to be expected. The rooms themselves are okay nothing to brag about. The d√©cor is up to date the overall room is clean and the beds are super comfy. The noise level from outside is annoying all night you hear Hahahaha, bang, bang,  then stomping up and down the hall, doors slamming, after several hours you just
Manager Response: Dear susie95603,  Thank you so much for your feedback regarding your visit with us.  I am glad to hear you felt the hotel design and conditions met your expectations.  I am sorry to hear that you felt the overall experience you had we did not deliver.  We hope that you will give us another opportunity to exceed your expectations.   Guest Relations Manager

Summary: We stay here while visting family often. Rooms are wonderful as is the pool. The staff is very helpful. It is in a convenient location to shop or quickly get to the coast without the hassle of being right near the shore. Walk to South Coast shopping center easily. Open to a pet stay with waiver. One drawback is high fee for parking nightly at 20 dollars.
Manager Response: Dear 2TravelersHo,  We will share with our team that you felt that they were very accommodating.  Our committment to our guests is to deliver the experiences they expect from Westin. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: This is Westin at it's best. The staff are great, they really understand what business people are looking for in a hotel. I have never had a very large room or suite here but the rooms are alll very comfortable and functional. Having a Starbucks on site is great. Being walking distance fron South Coast Plaza mall is great. Nice pool and decent size gym. The restaurant is a bit fussy but the food is very good.
Manager Response: Dear Sregdab28,  We are so glad to hear that you felt we lived up to the Westin brand experience that you expect.  We look forward to seeing you on your next visit. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: We enjoyed our recent stay for 2 nights.  We booked thru priceline and this is where we were placed for $69, which we were thrilled about!  However, we had not realized before that they charge $20 daily extra for parking- a little outrageous if you ask me!  The hotel staff were very polite, and the room very well appointed and roomy.  We traveled w/ our 2 daughters and had a room w/ 2 queen beds which worked great for us.  The hotel is very accessible to the freeway, connected to nice mall area by a walk-way and was only about 20 mins to Disneyland which we enjoyed on one of our days there.  We called after over a week from when we had stayed as we had left a pair of running shoes; they had them in their lost & found and were happy to mail them at our expense- I was thankful
Manager Response: Dear ray_ray047,  Thank you for choosing our hotel for your getaway.  The hotel is perfectly located and our team understands the needs of our guest.  We are delighted that you enjoyed your visit.   Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: great deal if you need to be in Costa Mesa!
Summary: I stayed in Costa Mesa for one night to see family who live in the area while I was in SoCal. I'd stayed at this Westin a few years ago--and it met the typical Westin standard. The room is nothing special, but it is a good size. The pool and gym are very nice. If you need to be in this area, this is a great place to stay--it's a short walk to South Coast Plaza for shopping and to several arts venues. I had a Starbucks coffee from the coffee shop. I also got a great deal from the Westin website that included a discounted room and 50% off of self-parking. Overall, it was an expected stay for a Westin. And, a lot of times, that's just what one wants when traveling--no surprises and a reliable, consistent (albeit not extravagant) experience.
Manager Response: Dear nbm5b,  Thank you so much for staying with us.  We look forward to your visit should you stay in Costa Mesa again. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: I am a frequent traveler with Starwood and Marriott brands, and Westin South Coast plaza never fails to disappoint.  I am staying today in my 4th stay at this property, and it is distinctive among Westins I have stayed at both within the U.S. and internationally. A few specific highlights: Service is excellent. Our front desk agent April learned that it was a special occasion (as I was bringing my spouse on this business trip), and April upgraded us to a great suite on the top floor - thanks April! Senior manager Hugo Barba is a great ambassador of the hotel and an inspirational example to his team. The property is incredibly well-maintained with extreme attention to cleanliness. I spent the last hour working out in their spa-like fitness center, and during the slow time of day
Manager Response: Dear MattewM60,  Thank you so much for your feedback.  It is enlightened to hear the impact that our staff has made on your stay.  It is clear that we have left you with a memorable experience and that you will return as a loyal guest.  We are dedicated to delivering on amazing experiences for our guests and it is great to see that we did just that for you.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: We live in Palm Springs and during the hot summer months we come and stay at the Westin South Coast every weekend with our beautiful dogs.  We are treated like family here and the staff are incredible and so caring.  We could rent a place for the summer months but because of the wonderful service we receive, the beautiful Hotel and oh!! so comfortable Heavenly beds, the big beautiful park right outside the doors that are always opened to us by smiling faces!, we have made this place our second home for the summer!  It has everything we want and desire right at our fingertips.  Also, it is located across the bridge to the South Coast Plaza Mall and there are so many awesome restaurants close by.    We also want to add that recently one of our dogs has been diagnosed with cancer
Manager Response: Dear Todd Y,  We value you as a loyal guest and look forward to your visit each summer.  Our Westin family truly has joined your journey in your extended family you bring with you.  It is a joy to see your beautiful dogs with you when you come.  We look forward to your many visits in the future and will be at your service any time you need the team for your special stays with us. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: A very chill hotel.  The outdoor waterfall with spiral staircases is beautiful.  They also had a lot of little nooks to settle in to enjoy the common areas.  We had a problem with the cleanliness of the room but it was fixed quickly.
Manager Response: Dear Gina A We are glad to hear that you felt the hotel has a beautiful use of outdoor space.  We strive to provide an environment that our guests' can thrive in.  We look forward to your return when in the Orange County area.   Guest Relations Manager.

Summary: Stayed here for 4 nights because I was going to attend 3 shows at the Segerstrom Center. This is a nice hotel. Nice lobby, nice seating, nice rooms-but nothing super special about the rooms. Good lines, good water pressure. The Segerstrom Center was literally steps from the hotel, down the elevator and walk across the park to the building. In the other direction was a bridge over the highway to walk to the mall, so that was excellent to have. The rooms either have a park view/greenery/more quiet or a pool view/a bit more noise due to the highway on that side of the building. The front desk was helpful when we needed it. Not thrilled with the internet fees, parking fees, extremely high cost of food. For a Thursday, Friday and Saturday stay we paid about $149 per night. We decided
Manager Response: Dear ssg47,  Thank you for your feedback regarding your experience at our hotel.  Our hotel is in the center of it all right at your fingertips.  We are glad to hear the location convenience met your needs.  We apologize for your experiences with the internet, restaurant and fees you felt did not meet your needs.  You are absolutely correct in stating that if you have issues with internet that you should not have to pay for it.  We want you to be satisfied with your experience and be able to reach your potential and if we do not deliver, we should make it right.  We will share your feedback with our talent so they can learn from it.  We hope you will give us another opportunity when staying in the area.   Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, good location, just a lot of charges for extras
Summary: The hotel is as one would expect from Westin.  The rooms were clean, updated and comfortable.  The staff was helpful and the location is good.  My only complaint is the add on charges for everything.  Package delivery $10 per box, printing one FedEx label was $6.80.  Internet was not free even for Starwood preferred members with status.  A salad delivered ended up being almost $40!    For a one night business trip these things really add up.
Manager Response: Dear dottie dog,  Thank you for staying with us and letting us know that you felt the rooms were clean, updated and comfortable. We look forward to your return.  Guest Relation Manager.

Summary: This was my second time staying at the Westin South Coast plaza, first was a business stay and the second for leisure, they were about 4 years apart. The hotel serves both types of customers well, although $11.95 for internet access is a bit steep.  The hotel overall was clean, lively and pleasant. The room was clean and spacious, with of course a comfortable bed.  I appreciated the complimentary bottle of water in the room. I also liked the free flavored water in the lobby during the evening, so much so I looked for it in the morning after my morning run. The hotel provides a convenient map of a running route for those interested in running outdoors it is 3.3 mile route and a 5.5 mile route. There were few dining options in the hotel, I tried the lettuce wraps and a cocktail in
Manager Response: Dear Itview,  Thank you so much for your positive feedback.  We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your visit and will return when staying in Orange County.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Wonderful biz stay, uber nice staff
Summary: I haven't stayed at the Westin South Coast Plaza for years, but will be back again soon. I'm loyal to the SPG brand - when my favorite LA area SPG hotels were sold out due to a large convention, I decided to stay in OC for the first night of my biz trip. My stay at this Westin far exceeded my expectations. It all started with Irma who checked me in at the SPG gold/platinum member desk. She was very professional and greeted me with a warm and enthusiastic welcome. I could tell she clearly loves her job and working with people. I was upgraded to an SPG preferred floor in a very quiet room at the end of a hall. I have no idea how she knew that was my preference, but I was very happy with the quiet location. I slept like a baby in the comfort of my clean and well appointed room. I
Manager Response: Dear MousseMake... It is wonderful that Irma, our guest service ambassador, made an emotional connection with you.  We thank you for your loyalty as a Starwood Preferred member and our ambassadors understand the importance of our guests being able to be at their best when traveling and it is comforting that we exceeded that goal for you. Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: The best hotel stay I have ever had
Summary: I came with two other guests.  We had a difficult drive from San Diego. Our car broke down on the freeway and we could have been killed. I mentioned this during a conversation I had with a front desk clerk, Sofiane, and he was very sympathetic. He even offered a no charge small upgrade of our room to one with a better view which we accepted.  I have never stayed at a hotel at this price level where we had the front door to the hotel opened for us. We enjoyed that service.  The battery on our cell phone was about to die. I went to the front desk and explained our situation and she first showed me some cell phone chargers that previous guests had left behind that I could possibly use on my phone. None were compatible so she offered to charge the phone with the charger the hotel
Manager Response: Dear spades17,  It means a lot to our team that you felt the hotel was the best experience you have ever had.  I have shared your comments with our ambassadaor, Sofiane, that he made an impact on your visit under the stressful circumstances you had experienced prior to visiting us.   Look forward to your return visit.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Consistently Delivers with Comfort and Class
Summary: I have been staying in hotels in the Costa Mesa, Newport Beach, Huntington Beach area every week for the past 5 months.  Although I have the option to stay with any major chain, the Westin South Coast Plaza is my hotel of choice.  This is because they offer a consistently excellent experience with gracious staff, extremely comfortable and well designed rooms, and great location. This place takes the cake for the travelling businessperson.  I especially have been impressed with the quality of service and enthusiasm from Joe Amezcua, one of the staff members at the front desk.
Manager Response: Dear Connor B, Thank you for expressing your satisfaction with your experience with us.  It is a pleasure to deliver experiences that are classy and comfortable for you.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Good shopping location, helpful hotel staffs & nice garden view
Summary: I have been staying at this hotel few times. I like the hotel location, very near to the big mall of South Coast Plaza where you find many shopping and food.  Parking is beside the hotel in multi-storey carpark.  Only drawback is the breakfast, its not buffet style.
Manager Response: Dear David Chan,  Thank you for your feedback about your visit.  The South Coast Plaza access to our hotel truly allows our guest to reach their potential and shop with ease.  Look forward to your return. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: This hotel was very very relaxing. The pool was nice and warm. The mall is right over the bridge. From high end stores to low end. Fridays is a 3 min walk. The steak house next door has the best smelling food! It's right off the highway. The rooms were clean. Starbucks in the lobby. The courtyard was relaxing.The staff was very friendly. No matter the time of day they were right there to open the door for you. They even let our friends park for free when they picked us up for site seeing. Overall great hotel.
Manager Response: Dear TLinds,  Thank you for commending our hotel for what we offer our valued guests like yourself.  We strive to provide service that truly stands out from our competition.   Guest Relations Manager

Summary: If your traveling on business and have a partner that has free time, it's a great location. Surrounded by 2 concert halls and a repertory theater, there is always a show to catch. Shopping is steps outside the hotel across the walking bridge is the nations largest concentration of elite retailers (boasts the nations highest annual sales of $1.5 Billion).   Fitness center is small yet overlooks the outdoor pool with a large glass window. Fitness equipment includes elliptical trainers, treadmills, bike and weights with a single bathroom with shower and essentials.  Service is good, hotel is clean, enjoyable atmosphere - lobby overlooks a waterfall with outdoor seating / indoor lobby bar. French Restaurant is excellent Pinot Provence and very attentive to guests attending shows.
Manager Response: Dear TravelFoodB,  Thank you for your comments regarding our hotel.  Our goal is to deliver experiences that make our guest feel special.  We hope that you will continue to choose our hotel when in the Orange County area due to the exceptional location and amenities we can offer at your fingertips.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary: We were delighted upon arrival to meet April C. She was warm and friendly as she was checking us in. She talked about our day and asked about where we were from. Her kind demenor was a warm welcome. Thank you April for taking time to make us feel welcome! You are a great ambassador for Westin.  The location is great; right off the 405 and accross the street from an amazing mall (South Coast Plaza).
Manager Response: Dear Michelle P,  Thank you so much for your feedback regarding April.  It is wonderful to hear that she made your stay memorable and that you feel she is an amazing Ambassador for Westin. We will make sure she is recognized for this.  Look forward to your return visit. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: This hotel was friendly, clean and had great customer service. They brought my husband cookies, chocolate covered almonds and Westin water as a special gift for his birthday with a birthday card. It really meant a lot to us! The beds were amazing I have never slept so good in a hotel and the shower was heavenly as they say. We would go back again. The one thing we wish they had was a hot tub so maybe in the future that will happen :)
Manager Response: Dear Nicole P,  It sounds like we made your stay a memorable one for your husband on his special day.  Thank you for choosing our hotel for your celebration.  We look forward to seeing you on your future visits. Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Don't plan to use the excercise room - too small
Summary: The location of the hotel is close to the SNA airport and a large shopping mall with a large number of restaurants.  The hotel is a pretty typical Westin, nothing special.  Had breakfast in the restaurant -  they forgot the omelet I ordered and had to leave before receiving it.  I got up at 6 am to use the gym ‚Äì packed with a waiting line to use any of the equipment ‚Äì not happy.
Manager Response: Dear dt95,  Thank you so much for your feedback regarding to your experience with our Westin Workout and our restaurant.  I would suggest that we have a couple guest rooms with the workout equipment in them that might meet your needs so you do not have to wait for equipment in our Workout facility.  I have shared your experience with our restaurant management team to ensure that this does not occur in the future.  I hope you will give us another opportunity to meet your needs when traveling to our hotel.     Guest Relations Manager.

Summary: I stayed at this hotel after winning a bid on Priceline. The area wasnt what I thought I would need but hey it was cheap. I was amazed first by the area it was in. There is a bridge that you can walk directly to south coast plaza from right outside the hotel and close to a large number of restaurants and shops.   Check in was a bit of a hassle. Showed up a little early and was told the king room I had requested was not ready and they would call when it was. No big deal, two hours later however when I came back to check on it I was told the king room I had wanted had been given away! I was very angry because no one even called to tell me about the situation. I demanded to speak to the manager and after a few minutes of having to explain the situation she promptly found me a king
Manager Response: Dear jreelfs,  My sincere apologies that we did not deliver on your arrival experience with a seamless interaction.  I am glad to hear that our leadership team was able to recover with style on how you were originally treated.  We look forward to your return visit. Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent Hotel choice for Orange County
Summary: Needed a place to stay for wedding in Orange County.  Extremely pleased with Westin SCP which is adjacent to one of the best malls in California and near Orange County airport.  Hotel has large rooms with "heavenly" beds, excellent linens, towels and toiletries.  Very clean. Only drawback was no late checkout and parking is across the street.  Unlimited dining nearby from fast food to 4+ stars.  Highly recommend and I would stay there next trip to Orange County
Manager Response: Dear Myptcra,  Thank you for chosing our hotel for your special event.  The hotel guest rooms are spacious and have the amenities to meet your needs.  We look forward to your next visit.  Guest Relation Managers

Summary Heading: Westin South Coast is a fine place to stay
Summary: Returned for their weekend package which is a great deal.  Rooms are spacious and clean, staff was courteous and service was excellent. Please just tell housekeeping not to knock at 8:30 am on a Saturday as it was my only chance to get some rest. Convenient location and only negative is valet parking was pricey Coffee maker with Starbucks in the room was a nice plus
Manager Response: Dear Rich W,  Thank you for staying with us and your feedback regarding our Housekeeping team.  I will make sure we share this with the staff so they understand how your experience was.   Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: A return trip to a very reliable hotel in a great location.
Summary: Everything about this Westin is polished. The reservations process, the Check-in, the Staff, the room, the pool, etc.
Manager Response: Dear JPTEncino,  Thank you for your comments on how you felt that your entire experience with us met your expectations.  Our team is committed to delivering the best experience possible with our valued guests.   Guest Relations Manager.

Summary: Stayed in  Jr. Suite for one night 4/26-4/27/12.  Great service at check in.   Room was comfortable, great bed and linens.  Bathroom could use some updating, especially the tub/shower.  Suite was large and more than enough room for a business meeting I had planned in the am.  Room service was great. Free wi-fi in the rooms. Overall a very nice stay.
Manager Response: Dear Amy S,  Glad to hear that you felt the arrival experience for you was memorable.  It is important to be able to enjoy yourself when traveling for business and relax.  We look forward to your return.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary Heading: Good Option Convenient to Irvine and O.C
Summary: I've been staying in this hotel every week for quite a while due to regular business travel. I like the location of this hotel since it is close to a variety of restaurants and other entertainment options, while also being a relatively fast commute to Irvine for work. The hotel isn't one of the nicest Westin's, nor is it one of the worst.   I did have some booking issues early on with King Size Bedrooms, but worked those out after a quick call with the reservation manager. Seemed pretty simple to me that if I book a King Size bed (usually at a higher rate than two double beds) that I should have a room with a King Size bed available when I check in. I guess like many travel-based businesses they overbook to ensure they sell to capacity. Anyhow, they were great about addressing
Manager Response: Dear seven21,  Thank you so much for your feedback regarding your frequent visits.  It helps our team understand the opportunities we have and how we can deliver exceptional experiences for our valued guests.  We look forward to your return visit and how we can make your stay more memorable.   Guest Relations Manager

Summary: This is my "go to" hotel when visiting family in O.C.  It's close to the airport, freeways, shopping and restaurants.  The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable.  The best part is they all treat my little furry companion (pup) like a "king"!
Manager Response: Dear sewfun2cook,  We are so glad that we are your "go to" hotel when visiting Orange County.  At Westin, we understand how important your furry companions are and that they feel at home.  It is great to hear that "pup" was treated like a king.   Guest Relations Manager

Summary: I stayed in this nice hotel for 4 days and found rooms to be spacious and spotless. Bedding was very comfortable. It is just 10 min from John Wayne International Airport (Santa Ana) and you have endless shopping options since you can use the skywalk from the hotel to the South Coast Plaza (a huge mall) or from the mall to other major stores (Old Navy, Marshall's, Best Buy, DSW shoes) and cinemas located a block behind the mall near the freeway. Other major stores are 1-2 blocks away (TJ Maxx, Ross, Target).   Breakfast in the hotel was just ok (I think they can improve selections) but lunch was great. I also tried Mastro's across the street (I believe they have another Mastro's in SoCal...you would not want to miss dining here), a steakhouse but their seafood and sushi menu ir
Manager Response: Dear lupilove04,  Our location is truly convenient and our guests tell us frequently that they can reach their potential when staying because they have all their needs at their fingertips.  Thank you for your feedback regarding to your breakfast experience.   Guest Relations Manager

Summary: We were here in 2010 for a conference and again, recently.  I gave a tepid review then and I still see some of the same problems.   Primarily, I feel nickeled and dimed while I am there.  Everything costs.  Internet, 11.95 a day and the signal was weak and kept shutting off.  Very frustrating.  Self park in a ramp that is not particularly convenient, $20 a day.  Even a charge for local calls...not that one would use that with cell phones, but still.  Once again, I had to ask for toiletries refills and coffee refills, even staying there 4 nights!  And, get rid of the silly fridge filled with over-priced items and just put in a fridge where we can store some beverages.  Filling up the silly can with ice to put a few sodas and juices got old, fast.  The doors slam unless held by
Manager Response: Dear Splanky,  We appreciate your feedback regarding your experience.  I am glad to hear that when you interacted with our staff you felt they were friendly and accommodating.  It is clear from your comments that we have some opportunities when meeting your expectations.  I hope that we can meet your needs on your next visit. Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Decent rooms, could teach the staff to smile
Summary: Rooms are decent and I usually got the corner rooms due to platinum status. However this also has its disadvantage of very week wifi signal. The parking fee is a bit high (didnt matter to me as I was on business but may matter to others). Location is fine close to the south coast plaza and few miles from the airport.  Staff never smiles not provides good upgrades. All in all a decent hotel to stay if you dont have to interact with the staff.(I stayed here regularly for over a year - never got a suite upgrade)
Manager Response: Dear patrikcables,  We value your loyatly to Westin as a Platinum member.  It is great to hear that we were able to give you an upgraded corner room for your visit.  We apologize for the internet issue you experienced in your guest room when staying with us.  We will escalate your concern to the appropriate individuals so we can resolve it.  It would be our pleasure to provide you with a suite upon your return.  Please call a manager on duty when you visit our area so we can deliver on your expectation.     Guest Relation Manager

Summary Heading: Location nirvana, outstanding room service, but inconvenient parking
Summary: We stayed at this hotel in February for a family birthday weekend, meeting several other family members travelling from across the country. All in all, we had four rooms, two of which were adjoining. Everyone was comfortable in their rooms with no issues. The rooms were fine - right up the middle for Westin, with the usual fabulous beds. The water quality in Southern California takes some getting used to and we all had the odd feeling of needing to take a shower after taking a shower. The water left an odd slimy feeling residue on the skin. But that is surely not the fault of the Westin.   What they can do something to improve is the parking situation. The garage is adjacent to the hotel, but the process of getting in and out of the garage was unnecessarily difficult and
Manager Response: Dear husbus,  Thank you for your feedback regarding your visit.  It is delightful to read your comments about how perfect the location of our hotel is.  It sounds like we have an opportunity to work on with the self parking offerings.  I have shared your feedback regarding to your renewing experience with our In-Room dining.  We look forward to your return. Guest Relation Manager

Summary: The Staff at this hotel is top notch - from front desk, to valet, to cleaning folks.  Friendly, helpful, kind.  The hotel is located near a huge mall (walking distance) for fabulous shopping and many dining options.  One night we chose room service for dinner and the food was timely and delicious!  I stayed on the 8th floor with view of the park.  The only downside I can see is the charge for parking.  Self parking in the garage close to the hotel is $20 per night, with Valet being $28 (plus tip).  So when calculating your daily rate add that to your bill.  There are no other close by options for a possible free place to park.
Manager Response: Dear Susannie,  We will share your feedback with our team that you feel they are "Top Notch."  Our team will truly appreciate knowing that.  Thank you for your feedback regarding the parking fees.  We will share this with the appropriate management.  We hope your travels bring your return visits to our hotel.  Guest Relation Manager

Summary: We have stayed here a number of times, annually, on business.  We travel from New Zealand and after a 12 hour flight, it's nice to arrive and find familiar surroundings.  Certainly, the hotel is a little dated, but in the years I've been coming nothing has deteriorated. Previously, I have stayed when improvements were being made, which is encouraging.  The rooms are a good size, beds super comfortable, lovely amenities, perhaps an overzealous shower head and the main reason for our trip is the proximity to South Coast Plaza.  Regarding this trip, I found everything as I've come to expect, although exceeding my expectations would be a nice surprise one day.  The only issue this time was the slow service in the lobby bar (we were there both days about 6pm), I say slow, but one day
Manager Response: Dear Juddster1,  We value your return visits to our hotel yearly.  We take pride in our building so our guests' have a renewing visit.  We anticipate having free wireless internet in our lobby starting late this year.  We look forward to your return visits. Guest Relation Manager

Summary: I have been staying at the Westin Costa Mesa consistently for over a year.  I feel that Tam D., Cheryl K., and My D. who work in the lobby Starbucks deserve special recognition.  They are incredibly attentive and always friendly to their customers.  They would start my drink for me as soon as I turned the corner and always greeted me by name.    I hope the hotel appreciates the work of these individuals as they make all the difference when choosing to stay at a place!   Mike D
Manager Response: Dear Michael D,  Thank you so much for taking the time to recognize our valued Guest Service Associates.  I absolutely agree with you that employees make all the difference in choosing your travels.  It is rewarding to hear that our staff made an emotional connection with you.  We will make sure that they are recognized for your feedback.  We look forward to your return visit. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: I love the Westin brand and this hotel was better than a non Westin option but not overly impressive. It's got older bones but is decently updated. Parking is too expensive for Orange County) but it is a very convenient location if you are there for the shopping or theater ( I was not there for either).  The grassy area was great for my dog especially since having recently moved to Phoenix, ANY grass is a pleasure!  Casual food options were limited to the hotel lobby or the mall next door.
