No kid friendly or vegan options. We would have walked over to the mall if my friend had brought a stroller.   One unsettling occurrence on my first night. I was at the lobby bar having a glass of wine when the fire alarm went off. Everyone in the lobby ignored it!  The bartender, the
Manager Response: Dear sherimba03,  Thank you so much for providing us with such valuable feedback.  I can see why you were troubled by the response you received under the circumstances.  This is not how we train our staff to respond during events of this nature.  I can assure you that we will ensure that we provide appropriate guidance to our team to ensure a situation like this is handled better in the future.  Thank you again for your feedback and we hope you will give us another opportunity to provide you with a memorable stay.   Guest Relations Managers

Summary: This was definitely a very nice hotel.  The rooms were spacious and the beds are very comfortable.  The sheets and pillow were nice, too.  The lobby, restaurant and waterfall were beautiful. There is a bridge that leads you directly to the South Coast Plaza.  Great stores and restaurants within the mall.  So never run out of food options.  Indeed, it was a very elegant, laid back hotel.  If I am in Costa Mesa again, I would definitely stay at this Westin.
Manager Response: Dear BruinMom,  I am so glad to hear that you felt our rooms were spacious and the beds are comfortable.  The food options are truly endless in our area.  It is nice to have a hotel you can stay and have everything you need at your fingertips.    Guest Relations Manager

Summary: The Westin South Coast Plaza is comfortable and convenient to various Orange County attractions. Soast Coast Plaza is easily accessible via a foot bridge, and the performing arts center is adjacent. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms are attractive with flat screen HD TVs and Westin's great bedding. Doors tend to slam, which mars the otherwise quiet atmosphere. Great fitness center looking out at nice pool area. Too bad there isn't a hot tub!
Manager Response: Dear sobaytravelguy,  Being comfortable when you travel can be a number one priority.  I am delighted to hear that you felt that you could rest when staying with us and our amenities met your needs perfectly.  Look forward to your return. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: Second time to visit this nice hotel. Excellent service; all staff are friendly and professional. Very nice pool area with beautiful fountains and comfy lounge chairs-a real treat to this sun-deprived Pacific Northwesterner! Large rooms and comfy beds & linens. My only complaint is the optional $12.95 daily charge for Internet; ridiculous! Just charge more for the room but include internet!
Manager Response: Dear NurseNancy12,  We take pride in delivering experiences that make an emotional connection with our guests'.  It appears we did just that for you based on your comments of "Excellent Service."  I appreciate the feedback regarding the internet fee and will communicate your thoughts up our management channels to see what we can do about that.   Guest Relations Manager.

Summary Heading: Westin, Wherefore Wi-fi? Seriously, Selling Sheets?
Summary: Okay, here's the thing: if you pay more for a hotel, you should get more, not less. Sure, the beds are nice. Fine, there are two heads in the shower. But in this day and age, wi-fi in the room is table stakes. I get free wi-fi at McDonalds, where I buy a $2 hamburger. This is a $250/night room. For business people. It's not just absurd that they want to charge for wi-fi, it's insulting.  Okay, here's a bit of good to counter the whinging: Kenna was working the counter that day when we checked in, and I made no secret of my disdain for their stupid policy. She upgraded us to Starwood suites, where wi-fi is included. Thanks, Kenna, you're a doll. She also worked very hard to get dinner reservations for myself and my travelling companions on the evening of Valentine's Day, no mean
Manager Response: Dear John_D_Collins,  I am disappointed to hear that we were unable to meet your needs on your vist in February.  I apologize that you felt that some of our collateral in our guest rooms is excessive marketing and that we charge for internet.  I am glad to hear that one of our ambassadors was able to assist in making arrangements for you during your staff that made you feel valued.  We truly appreciate your feedback and hope that you will give our hotel and Westin another chance to exceed your expectations.  We strive to take our guest feedback and make the appropriate adjustments to our business to allow our guests' to reach their potential when staying with us.    Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Great Hotel in a Great Location
Summary: This hotel is a very nice, understated hotel in the Westin tradition.  The location adjacent to the upscale South Coast Plaza and associated restaurants.  Secure car storage which is important to me.  We will return and stay for a longer visit next time.
Manager Response: Dear David S,  We look forward to your return when you can stay with us for a longer visit.  We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed our hotel and are planning on returning.   Guest Relations Manager

Summary: This hotel has great access to South Coast Plaza. Upgraded to the Junior Suite--very nice. Fitness room and pool area were great.
Manager Response: Dear luvncancun,  It is a pleasure to hear that we were able to upgrade you to one of our spacious suites and that the pool and fitness amenities met your needs.   Guest Relations Manager

Summary: Across the street from south coast mall. Walking distance to awesome restaurants. Great pool. Wonderful beds, What more can i say!!!!!!
Manager Response: Dear Furnman61,  It is great to hear that you feel the hotel is in the center of it all.  A great night sleep is so important when traveling.  Look forward to your return. Guest Relations Manager.

Summary: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights for a wedding in one of the traditional rooms. The rooms were nice and the bed was comfortable. We had a pool view room, which looks lovely at night when lit up. I loved the bath amenities!! It had a white tea fragrance, which was simply divine!  The room service is prompt, but the menu is overpriced. The best thing about the hotel is its proximity to the South Coast Plaza (the largest in the area) and so the strategically constructed pedestrian bridge from the hotel to the mall was a boon for the shopaholic in me! Also, the proximity ensures that one can stroll to the mall and choose from the various dining options there, instead of being stuck with the hotel menu.  Overall, it was a good experience.
Manager Response: Dear Travelisor,  I agree that our white tea fragrance is simply divine.  It has a soothing sensory experience that most people enjoy.  All of our Westin Heavenly products are available on our website should you want to enjoy in the comforts of your home.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary Heading: Great for business...but wouldn't recommend for romance
Summary: The Westin South Coast Plaza is without doubt a great hotel for business trips. The rooms are spacious and come complete with most things you could need (hair dryer, iron and board, etc)...they also have seriously powerful showers (always good first thing in the morning!) and one of the most comfortable beds I've slept in.  Other plus points include the heated outdoor pool and gym block...not large, but has good equipment. The service throughout the hotel is also second to none....from the moment you're greeted at the reception desk to the moment you check out, the staff are friendly, attentive and always happy to provide whatever you need.  Only one thing bugged me, namely the wi-fi connection. If you're here on business and need a reliable connection, you probably won't get
Manager Response: Dear Grainged,  Our staff would be delighted to hear that you felt you were treated second to none.  Thank you for the feedback regarding the Wi-fi connection.  We strive to provide services that assist our guests in reaching their potential.  Your feedback will assist us in ensuring we are delivering on that promise.   Guest Relations Manager

Summary: I've stayed at this hotel several times and always pleased; this latest stay the staff was particularly helpful and friendly. They also have an environmental program that allows you to put a hang tag on the door that you do not need maid service and you get a $5 voucher for food at the hotel. I like to see that hotels are getting away from this constant washing of towels use once and bath items replaced when they are not needed.  It was great.  Free shuttle from Orange County airport too!
Manager Response: Dear dolls111,  We are delighted to hear that you welcome our Green practices.  We are proud to be a Green Seal Certified hotel.  Our hotel as well as Starwood practices many sustainable options to reduce our carbon imprint on the planet.  We will continue our efforts to ensure we are doing our part to give back to the environment.   Guest Relations Manager

Summary: This hotel served its purpose of a clean, comfortable room for one night stay on a business trip.  I arrived late and left early, so I probably did not get a full perspective.  But everything was OK, if overpriced.
Manager Response: Dear Jack90291,  We look forward to the opportunity to serve you in the future so we can deliver on your expectations.  We work hard to deliver an experience to our guests and not merely just a satisfactory visit.  We welcome your feedback and have the full confidence that we can improve our services to provide you with an experience that is memorable and what you expect from the Westin brand.   Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: A Top Notch Hotel in Orange County
Summary: In town for a one-night stay at the Westin South Coast Plaza. As always, a first-class experience. Even though I was unable to get a suite upgrade on this stay, it was a pleasant experience from the start. Check in was not only a breeze, but friendly and professional. The agent even walked from behind the counter, shook my hand, and presented me with my room key packet. I felt appreciated and welcome. Room 1423 was a typical Westin deluxe room, complete with superb bedding and Starbucks coffee. Cocktails in the evening at the lively Westin bar is always a treat. Friendly staff and chatty customers. Valet parking was fast and efficient, even though they refused to give me the yellow Lamborghini parked in front. (I felt it was a fair trade for my 1999 Toyota; they, however, did
Manager Response: Dear ChiefDennis,  Glad to hear that you felt appreciated and welcome by our guest service staff. It is extremely important when traveling to be able to unwind at a hotel that understands your needs.  It appears we did just that.  Look forward to your return when you are in our area.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: I stayed here in early January for 3 days and got a great rate through Jetsetter.  I had lived in OC for several years and remembered it so was confident it would be nice. Very impressed with the sincere friendliness and helpfulness of the staff, the excellent food, and , of course, you can't find better shopping anywhere than the very close South Coast Plaza!!  Also, movie theaters are very close and the hotel is just off the freeway. So you are minutes away from Newport Beach, Huntington beach and Laguna.
Manager Response: Dear Winnsome,  Thank you for letting us know that our staff treated you with sincere friendliness and were helpful during your stay.  The shopping at South Coast Plaza is truly a great amenity the hotel has to offer.  Look forward to your return. Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel with convenient location
Summary: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights past december, and it was a very good experience.  Bed is really comfortable, room is spacious and clean.  The shower head could be a little bit higher, but the rest was just fine.  The hotel is convenient walking distant from South Coast Plaza, with the best luxury brands you can imagine.  Also close to our favorite Italian restaurant, Maggiano's... if you go there, order a Chopped Salad...amazing!
Manager Response: Dear Cenobre,  We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed the Heavenly Bed experience.  The bed continues to live up to the image of providing an experience that guests can leave rested and renewed.  The bed is now available at Pottery Barn as well as Nordstrom.    Guest Relations Manager

Summary: Joyce Chu was so professional and accommodating. My getaway with my granddaughter was special be cause she did such a good job to make it special. This hotel goes all out for its guests.
Manager Response: Dear Joy S,  Thank you for recognizing Joyce.  We will make sure she knows that she made your stay special.  Look forward to making your future stays as memorable as your last.   Guest Relations Manager

Summary: This is a wonderful hotel.  Very attentive staff, excellent service.  Consistent and flawless high Westin quality.   The rooms are large with all the updated amenities you would expect from a Westin.  Right next to South Coast Plaza, John Wayne airport, and the Segerstrom Center, the hotel provides an excellent location for dining and entertainment options.   Which also means the hotel is very often sold out, and there really is no other hotel that matches the Westin in the area.  The only tip I can provide is to avoid the ‚Äúpool view‚Äù rooms, aka ‚Äúfreeway view‚Äù rooms.  The park view rooms look out over the performing arts center and avoid any freeway noise.
Manager Response: Dear mmppwwzz,  Thank you for acknowledging that our staff is attentive and provides excellent service.  Our team takes pride in delivering services that assist our guest being at their best.  Our location is a great place to be able to meet all your needs and we are confident that we will be able to continue delivering on our guest expectations.  Look forward to your return.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary: While our stay was brief, it was super nice with staff that were very helpful and friendly.  And the hotel. And the beds, wow, we didn't want to get up!  Would recommend and heading back there again next week.
Manager Response: Dear JoeFonthill,  The Westin Heavenly Bed experience really does make it difficult to want to leave your guest room.  Glad to hear that it gave you an experience that was renewing. Look forward to your return visit as mentioned.  Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: The perfect stay - made for the perfect beginning to the New Year!
Summary: My family and I stayed here overnight from 12/31 to 01/01 - we wanted an easy little getaway to ring in the New Year.  We have four tiny dogs (3 chihuahuas and 1 mini maltese).  Finding a hotel is always difficult, because 99% of hotels have that ridiculous NONREFUNDABLE "cleaning" policy for guests with pets, of either $50 or $100.  That's absolutely insane, especially considering that I've seen the housekeepers clean pet rooms, and they don't do anything special.  Plus, it's not like we're traveling with huge dogs that have the potential to make a real mess.  So after doing a lot of searching, I finally discovered The Westin - the location is absolutely perfect (right next to the huge mall and dozens and dozens of terrific restaurants - from casual to fine dining; and only
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We are glad that you felt that our dog friendly hotel met your needs.  We understands the importance of traveling with your valued pets and to find a hotel that can accommodate your needs is important.  We will look forward to your return.   Sincerely, Guest Relations Manager.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel with large rooms, but alittle inconvenient.
Summary: Decided to give this place a try, since it's a pet friendly hotel.  A prime location for the hotel, which is quite large and nicely decorated. Checked in later than we expected.  The person who helped checked us in was speaking so fast that I can barely catch up with what she was telling me. Since we drove, we went with the self-park service, not realizing that the parking structure is separate from the main building.  So, we had lug our baggages and trek to the main building and our room. Once getting into the room, the room was large, but maybe because of the colors, the decor, or, maybe with all the space, the room doesn't feel as welcoming as the other hotel rooms we've stayed in. Although the bed was a king, for some reason, sleep quality wasn't great.  It might've been the
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for the great feedback you have provided.  This level of detail is important for us so we know exactly how we can improve for future experiences.  It is dissappointing to hear that you felt the Westin Heavenly Bed experience was not to your satisfaction.  We strive to provide the best sleep possible.  We will continue to make the appropriate adjustments to our guest experience to ensure the highest level of satisfaction.  Thank you for your feedback. Sincerely, Guest Relations Manager.

Summary Heading: Great food, great service, great stay!
Summary: Whatever you do at this property eat at the pinot province. The food is exceptional.   Rooms are large and comfortable. The bed was.predictably great.   Special thanks to virginia at the front desk for a smooth and easy check in when we needed it the most (late on Christmas night)!  This Westin is highly recommended for orange county stays.  PS we had an exercise bike, fitness ball and adjustable dumbbell in the room. Nice touch!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to recognize Virginia.  She does a great job for us as our Front Desk Associate.  She will be excited that she made your stay memorable.   Sincerely, Guest Relations Manager.

Summary Heading: One of my absolute favorite hotels in Orange County
Summary: Being right across the street from the South Coast Plaza is a huge plus but what makes this hotel so great is: 1) Great staff- especially April and Joyce at the front desk, they are absolutely top notch 2) Excellent Gym and Pool 3) Westin Beds 4) So close to everything  I stay at Westin Hotels about 50 times a year and this is one of their best hotels in the entire system.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We are so glad to hear that you feel our hotel ranks #1 in the many hotels you have visited.  We feel honored to be given such an amazing comment.  Thank you for the recognition for our team.  We will make sure they are given your feedback. Sincerely, Guest Relations Manager.

Summary: A clean, quiet Westin, close to some of the best shopping in Southern California. The guests seem to be a good mix of business travelers and (shopping?) tourists. Walk across the street to the best mall in Southern California...
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Our hotel is centrally located to shopping and entertainment.  I hope you were able to take advantage of the amazing shopping experiences at South Coast Plaza.  Look forward to your return. Sincerely, Guest Relations Manager.

Summary Heading: Comfortable rooms with a great location
Summary: This is a fantastic hotel for those looking to shop and/or dine at the nearby South Coast Plaza. It is also very convenient for those working inthe nearby area. In either the case, the hotel offers large rooms with ample amenities you would expect from a Westin. Taking into account that you can stay at this hotel for around $150 per night, it is decent value for the money, as well.  Note that although not well advertised, the hotel provides shuttle service in and around the vicinty, including complimentary pickup and dropoff for the close by John Wayne Orange County (SNA) airport.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  It is so important to get a great value.  It is good to know you felt that you received value for your money spent and the hotel helped you reached your potential.   Sincerely, Guest Relations Manager.

Summary: This is the second year I take my wife to this hotel to celebrate her birthday. We get tickets for the Performance Arts Center (several options during this season), and spend the time enjoying the festive surroundings, decorations, etc. Without having to worry about driving or being any other place in a hurry or pressed for time. Everything is within short walking distance. Hotel staff is really appreciative of guests, and attentive to individual needs. Front desk personnel really look forward to accomodate special requests. Planning on making it part of the Christmas tradition.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We appreciate you taking the time to post such positive comments - it's always great to hear that our guests enjoy themselves during their travels.    Thank you for your review, and we look forward to being part of your family holiday tradition.    Sincerely, Guest Relations.

Summary: Great location for shopping or to walk to one of the offices located in the area - other than that it is a standard Westin Hotel - nothing given for Gold status except a thanks - bathrooms need an upgrade - nice enought though - pinot providence is great
Manager Response: Dear valuable Starwood Preferred Gold member,  We appreciate your feedback regarding your feeling of how you are treated when at our property.  We truly value your loyalty and take your feedback serious.  We hope you will give us another opportunity to exceed your expectations.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary: We stayed two nights at the Westin Costa Mesa and enjoyed our stay tremendously. Fantastic location, comfortable rooms and yes, Heavenly Beds. Best Shower of all the hotels we staye dit during our three week trip around California. South Coast Plaza is a five minute walk away and lots of good shopping and restaurants. The staff were friendly and helpful. We will definitely go back if we are in the area.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us.  We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay tremendously.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary Heading: Got luxury at a budget price
Summary: Stayed here one night before flying out of John Wayne Airport. Because we booked through a "blind bid" site, we paid for a Motel Six and got a Westin -- including their great service. When we left that morning, we were saddened that we couldn't have made it a longer stay.  Room amenities include full bath, phone, AC, hair dryer, radio alarm, coffee maker, in-room safe, TV with 42 channels, and iron & board. Free amenities include pool, tennis court, airport shuttle, and a wonderful lobby / relaxation area. Parking and internet access are extra. No breakfast is included.  Onsite, the hotel has a restaurant, a cocktail lounge, and a convenience store; none of which we sampled.  The comfort level of the bed and the bathroom were spectacular -- nothing better than a comfy soak and a
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Glad to hear that you felt you received value for your price paid.  We hope you will choose us in your travels next time.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary: A well-located property near South Coast Plaza, OC Performing Arts Center, great restaurants, and close freeway access.  Rooms are beautiful and comfortable.  Restaurant and bar areas upscale and great food.  Staff helpful and friendly.  We stay here often and LOVE it.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We look forward to seeing you on your frequent visits.  See you soon.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel for three days over the Thanksgiving holiday while visiting friends in Orange County. The hotel decor is nice, though you can tell this is an older property that has been renovated.   If you stay here, though, be prepared to spend an extra $50/day at least in extra charges even if you don't plan to make use of the minibar, hotel restaurant, etc. Self-parking is $20/day and internet access is $16/day *per computer*. The internet fee is particularly galling as it only provides 5 MB bandwidth per ever $16 charge -- that's a fee that makes cell phone providers look generous.   Perhaps I ought to recalibrate my expectations for the LA-metro area, but as a Starwood Preferred Guest member, I expected better treatment. We stayed at the SLS
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  We apologize you felt that the hotel fees were excessive.  We hope that you will give us another opportunity to provide you with an experience that is memorable.  We value you as a Starwood Preferred member.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary: The property is renovated, great gym/lobby.  5 min walk to best mall in So Cal.  Rooms are small ( i was given a suite, which would be small for a normal room).  Good news is they have shuttle form SNA ( airport), bad news 45 minute wait for ride.  This could be a 4 start + with some work from the team.  For $200 a night you have better options.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for your feedback regarding the size of our guest rooms.  It is great to hear that you enjoyed the prime location.  We hope that we may meet your needs in the future.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary: We had previously stayed at the Westin Long Beach and moved to Westin So. Coast Plaza to visit friends/relatives in the area.  We couldn't have asked for a better location.  The hotel itself is gorgeous with a waterfall encased in glass in the lounge and an incredible view of the city lights from the 14th floor.   You are within walking distance of the South Coast Plaza Mall and the cities Perforning Arts Center also abuts the property.  All freeways are within minutes of the property as well.  It is a fantastic central location for starting one's trip off with great ease.  We loved our stay.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We are glad to hear that you loved your stay with us.  The bridge that connects our hotel to South Coast Plaza truly makes it easy for our guests to find their needs in a brief walk.  We hope to see you again.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary Heading: Great overall, with a few snags
Summary: We spent one night in this hotel for a brief weekend getaway using our Starwood points, which probably afforded us a room on a higher floor. There are a few cons but not enough to deter us from staying here again. Let's start with the Pros...  PROS: ‚Ä¢ quiet and elegant, with a clean, contemporary decor ‚Ä¢ GREAT location if you don't need to be near the ocean ‚Ä¢ gym opens early/closes late and overlooks the heated pool ‚Ä¢ Starbucks coffee in the room ‚Ä¢ bathrobe also in room ‚Ä¢ clean overall  CONS [in room]: ‚Ä¢ no outlets near bed ‚Ä¢ no towel bar in bathroom [this was a surprise, and a real mystery...such a basic item to omit!] ‚Ä¢ no slippers [you'd think if they provided robes they'd provide slippers too...oh well] ‚Ä¢ bathroom tiles and grouting showing obvious age and wear [but the rest
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for informing us of the opportunities we can improve to meet our guests needs.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a quick getaway
Summary: Great location for a quick getaway, next to world class shopping and dining.  Hotel looks recently renovated.  Only problem is no spa, not even a jacuzzi in the pool area. How can you justify that for a hotel in the rich Newport Beach area that seves a rich clientele. Next to great cultural possibilities available at the Orange County Performing Arts Center.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We hope that your travels bring you to our area again.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary: We needed to be near shopping and the beaches for a VERY quick weekend for a family of 4 in 2 separate rooms, so this was the most convenient if you have a budget in mind but want an above average place to stay. Rooms were nice, but bathrooms need updating. Lobby is very pretty....waterfall in background with beautiful poolside (did not use because of weather)...but very surprised that this hotel doesn't have a hot tub on premise! (disappointing!) Great location to South Coast Plaza Mall and near great restaurants! Short drive to the beaches. Overall I'd say it's a great place to stay if you want to be near the mall, but if you want to be closer to the beach and pay more choose another hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for alerting us that a hot tub would make our guest experiences more memorable.  We look forward to having you with us in the future.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary: Stayed one night for a company party.   Room was nice . Very clean.   Nothing to special about the room but it had what most are looking for .   Nice Bed , nice water pressure  etc ....   Also the staff were ALL VERY VERY Nice and were always helpful
Manager Response: Dear Traveler,  We take pride in our service and we are glad to hear that our staff made your experience a memorable one.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary Heading: Very nice but a bit too corporate
Summary: To me, personal touches are free wifi, delicious food and genuine service. This hotel has VERY polite service but nothing feels genuine.   Room service was tough. Quick and polite but sub par food. Wifi $12 and was charged once for laptop and again for ipad. Of course he removed the second but had i said nothing the corporate greed of westin would have kept my money.   The hotel is very nice though with big rooms, great location and peaceful.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for your feedback regarding to what personal touches make a difference for you.  We truly appreciate feedback so we can work on how to provide experiences for our guests that are memorable and help them to reach their potential.  We hope that you will give Westin another try.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary: Westin South Coast Plaza is a shoppers dream, located close to the John Wayne airport and right across from some of the best shopping in the world.  You also have the Orance County Performing Arts Center adjacent to it.  The staff is friendly and personable, and the restaurant is a Joachim Spilchal member.  Can't go wrong.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  It is great to hear that you felt the staff were friendly and personable.  Our associates take pride in delivering Westin experiences.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary Heading: Was a  GREAT place for a girl's getaway
Summary: This trip was such an important trip for my best friend and I. My husband and I are getting ready to move and we wanted a fun trip that would concentrate on our favorite thing SHOPPING!! I  knew right away the Westin would be the best place to rest  for a few days of hard core shopping  around the O.C. I looked and  found a great  "package" for our trip. As the day approached we were so excited! We parked the car and went to the reservation desk where we heard  the words "the package you booked isn't available on these days". I felt my stomach drop and I started to cry (just couldn't control my disappointment. At that point an "angel" named Joyce walked up...and told us  that the package wasn't available BUT she was going to make sure we had the best time ever..and she came
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  It is rewarding to hear that Joye made your experience a memorable one.  It sounds like you were able to shop and enjoy the hotel for your special day with us.  We look forward to seeing you on your next visit with us.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary Heading: Perfect location for Orange County events with some of the best shopping on earth right next door...
Summary: The Westin South Coast Plaza was just what we needed after a concert at Angles Stadium. Close by, with shuttle service, and comfy beds. Service was attentive most of the time. Clean rooms(I own a housecleaning business) and room service were well within standard. Many kiosks(Starbucks, pastry/lunch/deli) are good casual options. It was great to walk across a bridge n be at one of the best malls in the west. Nice and pretty quiet for such a big event (we saw U2 n Lenny Kravitz). I and my hubby had complaints;)
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We are glad to hear you felt your room was clean and the location met your needs.  We hope to see you again.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary: Great hotel, great staff, great location! We arrived for a 3 night stay off a cruise with a toddler before 11am expecting to cool our heels for a few hours prior to check in. However, we were greeted by a fabulous employee at reception, Joyce, who checked us in immediately and had our bags taken to the room with us by a friendly porter. The Westin is linked by a bridge to South Coast plaza and is in the best location for shopping. The pool is superb, the beds and shower heavenly. We can't fault the hotel. As we had a 14 hour flight home from LAX leaving at 10.30pm, we asked for a late check out so our toddler could have her lunch time nap. The fabulous Joyce, was as charming as ever and arranged a 3pm check out. Fabulous customer service! Thanks.
Manager Response: Dear valued guest,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience regarding your stay.  We will share your comments with Joyce so she knows how she was able to make you feel special.  Look forward to your return.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary Heading: Really nice hotel. Great staff, location, style, room. Westin class!
Summary: I had a conference at the Westin South Coast Plaza in Costa Mesa, CA. I loved every aspect of it, as the title says. Valet parking is around $28, I think. I parked at the garage across the street and paid $20 through the hotel directly. My room rate was $150. Free wifi and water bottle for Starwood members.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us.  Our staff appreciates the feedback on how they made your experience a great one.  Look forward to seeing you again.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary: My wife and I have just returned from a wonderful two night stay at the Westin South Coast Plaza.  Those Westin Heavenly beds are truly the best.  The staff is very friendly and willing to make our stay as relaxing as possible.  The hotel proximity to the performing arts center and to the shopping mall just across the pedestrian bridge  makes for an easy access for shopping and entertainment.  The restaurant selections at South Coast Plaza Mall are also winners and include Marche' Moderne (which I have already given an Excellent rating) and Antonello's for good Italian.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your Heavenly Bed.  Our restaurant and our local partners really do make a stay complete.   Thank you for staying with us.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary: Stayed here 2 nights this past weekend with husband for a wedding in Dana Point. We really liked the hotel. Joyce at the reception desk was very friendly and helpful. We asked for a king size bed and she was able to give it to us, stating that it was an upgrade to the 11th floor. That we really appreciated, considering we booked through a third party. The room offered a nice view overlooking the South Coast Repertory, which was even better at night. It was spacious, modern and spotless throughout. We really enjoyed the Heavenly shower heads, the Heavenly bed, and the in-room coffee and tea service for a night cap.   Easy access to the freeways to our destinations of the day. Would have done some great damage at South Coast Plaza just across the street, but we were too busy
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  It makes all the difference when one of our staff members can take care of our guests needs.  Thank you for recognizing Joyce for her being able to take care of you.  We look forward to your return.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary Heading: Good for business trip if in the area.
Summary: Comfortable and friendly. Nice decor. Walking distance to large mall and a few restaurants. Easy access to highway. Negatives would be parking is a tad high and no free Wi-Fi access (didn't pertain to me but I overheard a few people ask).
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We hope that you will come back and visit our hotel on your next visit.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary: After finally locating the property we were greeted by a friendly staff. They alerted us they "upgraded" us to a King room, what we had reserved, on the 14th floor, there were 16 floors.  We are 4 star elite owners, I am not sure why this room would ne considered an "upgrade". The ceilings are still popcorn, only one head in the heavenly shower worked (one head is typically turned off to conserve water, however when you turn on the second head) it usually works) there were broken tiles around the tub with dark mold in the grout. The wood underneath the sink was showing signs of water damage.  As always, the heavenly bed did not disappoint, it was heavenly. The headboard, however was loosely attached and moved if touched. We were told our room, 1408, faced the pool, at 11:00 at
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We value your feedback regarding your guest room experience.  We take your feedback serious and will ensure that each of your comments is looked into.  The great news is we are already looking at our room enhancements that the property will undergo in the future.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary Heading: Top notch hotel, wonderful staff, great stay!
Summary: Love the vibe of this hotel. Always a buzz of acitivity and a classy yet very comfortable environment. The staff is most friendly and engaging and does so in a most professional manner from the Valets, Front Desk folks, and Maid Service, and the evening Lobby Bartender were our particular interactions.  A very well cared for property from top to bottom. Rooms are just perfect...spacious, comfortable, and clean. Beds are as advertised, heavenly.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We will make sure our guest service team is informed that you felt they were highly engaged.  We truly strive to make memorable experiences for all of our guests.  It appears we made that possible for you.  Thank you for letting us know.   Guest Relations Manage.

Summary: This is our favorite OC hotel. It is 15 minutes from PCH, 10 minutes from the airport, across the street from South Coast Plaza and close to our daughter's home. That being said, the housekeeping has slipped a little since the last time we visited (2010): forgot to replenish the kleenex, even though we left the empty box on the counter; forgot to replenish bottled water; at check-in there was only one robe hanging in the bathroom so we called for a second robe. The next day, they removed both robes and left only one clean one hanging on the door. (They did the same thing the next day, too.) It may be they are in the middle of training new personnel, but it was a little bothersome. All in all, it is still a Westin where you always know you'll have a good night's sleep.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I understand how important it can be to have the simple comforts of a guest room and how the housekeeping staff plays a critical role in this.  Thank you for allowing us an opportunity to ensure we are providing our staff with appropriate learning.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary Heading: Good for a late SNA arrival
Summary: We stayed here for a night before heading down the coast.   It was a pretty standard Westin experience. One plus is that it appears to be more of a business destination, so we got an excellent upgrade for our SPG status since the guests were mostly huge wedding groups, kids' sports team, a high school football team, etc.   The guests described above made the place a little crazy and gave it the feeling of a suburban Sheraton during a youth soccer tournament. Lots of kids roaming the halls in socks, big groups of people in the lobby, etc.  The pool is beautiful for an early-morning swim. Unfortunately, the remains of late-night partiers were still littering the pool area when we arrived around 7:30 am. It is a public area that anyone on one side of the hotel can see from their
Manager Response: Dear Valued SPG Guest,  Your membership as a Starwood Preferred Guest is very important to us.  Your feedback regarding how you felt when with us will help us to ensure we make the appropriate changes to our operation so we may enhance all of our guests experiences.  Thank you. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: This is the first time we ever stayed at this hotel.  We chose this hotel because of the location close to where we had to go and the Westin standard and we were surely not disappointed.  We were promptly checked in and from the bellboy to the front desk everyone was helpful and friendly.  Room is nicely appointed and spacious.  Bed was very comfortable.  Short walking distance to the South Coast Plaza Mall, right off the freeway, real convenient to get around.  However I did not give the hotel excellent rating because the bathrm did not have cotton balls/q tips which I find it a necessity for a hotel like Westin.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, We truly appreciate your feedback regarding the additional amenities in the guest room bath that would help make your experience better.  We are glad to know that you felt the hotel was centrally located and would return based on how the staff made you feel and the hotel environment convenience.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary Heading: Fantastic staff. Grab and go meals. Lovely pool area.
Summary: The hotel staff was so incredibly friendly. And, if you get Korey to help you, he'll give you driving directions along with sage advice about life in general ‚Äì if you happen to need it! There's a Jerry's deli across the street for breakfast, the mall for anything else your heart desires and some pretty great people watching on the main level. I took my seven year old swimming and we owned the pool, heated to perfection under starry southern California skies. We swam around goggled eyed and then took the elevator from the second floor to our room. No traipsing through the lobby with mascara trickling down my cheeks. A definite plus!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  It is great to know that Kory helped you to reach your potential when you were with us.  The South Coast Plaza really does have everything you can possibly need.  We hope to have you back when you are in this area again.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary: close to airport, easy access to shopping and freeway. I especially liked the workout facility
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to acknowledge how Sophia took care of you.  Look forward to seeing you again.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary Heading: A good Westin-not the best one but nothing to complain about
Summary: Stayed in many Westins before and this is just like them, but i dont know, nothing special about it. The room was loud since its near the freeway but it was fine, a few hiccups meaning not as super clean/newly polished as other Westins but again nothing to complain about. The lobby area with bar/waterfall is pretty and the restaurant is very good. Service was great and its located in the quiet Costa Mesa, across the street from the big south coast plaza mall. If i was in the are yes I would stay again, but just didn't wow me. It does the job good.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you so much for staying at The Westin South Coast Plaza Hotel.  We are delighted that you felt our location was convenient for your needs.  We hope that you will give us another opportunity to provide you with service that is memorable.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary Heading: This is one of the best hotels!
Summary: When I go to the area I always stay at this hotel. The staff is pleasant, accommodating and always ready to help with any problems or needs. The hotel is clean and updated and has a wonderful area to sit outside by a waterfall. I have stayed at this hotel 4 times in the last 2 months and look forward to going there again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,   Thank you for allowing us to exceed your expectations.  We hope your travels bring you back soon.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary: Stayed two nights for my cousin's wedding in this hotel. We were helped graciously by Eric during check-in.  It was only 1pm when we checked in but he found a room that was ready on the 12th floor and gave us our keys even if technically check in is at 3pm.  The room was standard US size with 2 queen beds and a good size bathroom.  There was a 42 inch flat screen tv, working phones and coffemaker.  We didn't avail of the $11.95  per day wi-fi.  We had a great view of the pool from our 12th floor room.  The beds were queen size and truly lived up to its name called "sleeper bed".  It was firm and perfect for my aging back.  I have to say it was one of the best hotel beds I ever laid my back on.  Parking is  secure and not too far from the entrance.  It is $20 for self-parking and
Manager Response: none

Summary: Clean rooms, comfortable bedding, nice gym, ok pool, beautiful grounds. Starbucks on first floor. Have stayed there twice and would definitely return
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Glad to hear that you liked the location.  Look forward to your return.   Guest Relations Manager.

Summary Heading: A great pick for your shopping+beach trip in Orange County
Summary: The Westin has an ideal location right next to the South Coast Plaza a premium shopping mall, also home to theaters and entertainments. The hotel is also next to another musical theater where my coworker and I watched Mid-Summer Night's Dream.   The hotel is well maintained with possibly the cleanest condition amongst all hotels in Costa Mesa, Irvine and Santa Ana. Of my 50+ stays in the place, never had I one encounter with anything unpleasant. The one time a moth showed up in my room, the security guy was called up and got rid of it in 5 minutes.   Interacting with the front desk staff in this hotel is especially satisfying. Every time I am reminded that this is exactly the great service I expect out of Westin and a hotel of this price range. The staff here are friendly,
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: This is our "go to" hotel for Southern California!
Summary: We booked our reservation online and got a great price on the prepaid reservation.  At the last minute we decided to upgrade to a Jr. Suite because we were traveling with our 14 yr old son.  The staff was very accommodating and pleasant.  We have never had a better sleeping arrangement in a hotel.  The location was excellent for us.  Just five minutes from the airport, an easy walk to an amazing shopping area.  We just loved Costa Mesa and a big part of it was the Westin South Coast Plaza.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The Westin is our second home
Summary: We have been going to the Westin for over eight years.  It is the only Hotel we go to when we visit the beach from Palm Springs, CA.    We discovered it through a friend who booked it for us for a wedding.  Much to our surprise, they not only welcome people with open arms and a family friendly attitude, but dogs also.  We have two that that mean the world to us and everyone who works there treat us ALL like royalty.  Even our dogs get their own beds, water, and food dishes sent to the room.  In fact this weekend our dog Riley was sick and we received a letter of concern and a little dog tag attached to the note.  Everyone asked about him during our stay and found us a local vet to go to on a Sunday.  It was incredible beyond what we expected.   We go almost every weekend,
Manager Response: none

Summary: I don't take my time to review standard hotels or attractions.  You know what you are getting when you book either the Four Season or the Holiday Inn.  It has to be spectacularly bad or spectacularly good to move me to take the time to write about a property like that.  Well, the Westin South Coast Plaza deserves my taking my time.  In general, the hotel is standard Westin.  Rooms, etc,. like every other.    Things went south before we even got there.  We flew into Orange County airport (which as an aside, don't fly into LAX if you can avoid it.  LAX is for suckers.  Orange County airport is about 20 minutes south (with no traffic), is small, now security back up.  Fly there.  Anyway, so we arrive and had already confirmed with the hotel a shuttle.  The hotel is all of about 7

Summary: My family and I stayed here for one night after going to the Orange County Fair.  This was a basic Westin stay, clean, descent size and comfortable.... but nothing special. Unlike other reviews, we were given an option of self parking. We got our room with SPG points, however I would not have paid the $250 per night rate it was going for. Good location for the fair and South Coast Plaza. There are plenty of eateries nearby.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Hotel should really be called The Westin across the long, walking bridge from the south coast plaza!
Summary: Kind of an interesting Westin.  Smaller hotel.  No gift shop, but small quick serve Starbucks.  One restaurant on property that was not open for lunch, but the bar has a really good menu that is definitely overpriced - standard for a hotel.  Walking bridge outside to get over to South Coast Plaza, but it's a really long walk.  I took my car over there because I knew I didn't want to walk back that distance with packages.  The location is convenient, but unless I was there for business, I personally would not stay there since I am from the area. One of the things that I think is important is don't be misled and think that the hotel is at the mall since it's not.  I have stayed at hotels around the country that are really at the mall, and this one is not.  My standard room was
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Outstanding property, service, and proximity to key places
Summary: As a world traveler, I always appreciate finding a new hotel that exceed my expectations. The Westin South Coast Plaza did just that.  The service from the front desk to room service never skipped a beat.  The mini-suite was well appointed and extremely comfortable.    This property is ideally located within a comfortable walking distance to a fantastic shopping mall, great restaurants, and theatre.    Anyone staying here to shop, eat, and enjoy performances will be happily well-provided for by this top property!  We're going back just to enjoy a weekend again!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Grout/broken toilet seat trumps nice pool
Summary: I arrived rather late, had to wait in front of a rather impersonal agent.  The lobby and pool area are quite nice, the room needs some work.  No reason to have a broken toilet seat and there was grout all over the shower.  Tell management they need to spiff up the rooms.    Rather high fee to park a car.  I with they would put it on their website in a more obvious place when checking rates.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My boyfriend and I stayed at The Westin South Coast Plaza for 3 nights. The front desk agent who checked us in, Kory, was friendly, welcoming, helpful, and started our stay off on a great note.   The room itself is exactly what I expect from a Westin hotel - clean, spacious, attractive, and comfortable. The walkway to the shopping centre was most convenient, and the location of the hotel was perfect for us as we visited Dana Point, Laguna, and Newport during our stay. Valet was quick and efficient, and the attendants were friendly and helpful -  definitely well worth the fee.   The lobby is beautiful, and the pool area is quite nice. As noted in some of the other reviews, the doors are a little noisy but it didn't affect our stay overall, as everything else was great and
Manager Response: none

Summary: Ah, you go into your "luxury" room, you sink into your "heavenly bed" you fall into a nice peacerful slumber and suddenly....KA-BAMMM!!!  You're dragged from sleep by someone slamming a door next door.  For the next several minutes, these door slams continue.  Whether from the same room or another room is not important.  The noise is VERY jarring!  And why does this happen?  Because the doors are set up in a way that virtually makes it impossible for them to do anything BUT slam when they are closed!  Why a luxury hotel would have doors like this is beyond me.  My room was on the "preferred guest" floor, so I wonder if it was worse on other floors, but this happened all the nights I was there, usually after midnight and most jarringly at around 2:30 a.m.!  Now given that, the
Manager Response: none

Summary: Been back many times will continue. Great service from professional and friendly bar tenders Ashley and Kiana, they make the lobby experience special.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Adequate - not really a Westin experience
Summary: I stayed at the Westin South Coast Plaza at Costa Mesa for a single night. As a platinum guest I expected some basic things. Room was basic (and not upgraded, but you can't expect everytime).  There is no executive lounge or location for complimentary breakfast. Room was comfortable and spacious though, with good air cond control. Self parking $20 at garage next door, or $28 valet. Pool area has nice lounges/chairs but there is no service aroudn the pool despite a "resort" like feel. You have to order through room service using a phone.  Gym was OK with good equipment.  All up, disappointing for a Westin experience.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice, clean & comfortable. So worth the price... 140 dollars.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Most convenient to all that the area offers
Summary: We always choose this hotel when visiting the area. It's right across the street from a major shopping center and lots of restaurants. Although we drive, John Wayne Airport is close by. The rooms are comfortable, large and clean. We chose day trips to the Laguna Sawdust and arts festivals, Newport Fashion Square, and walked to dinner at area restaurants. There's a wonderful restaurant located in the hotel as well. Scott's Seafood, our choice for years, was a disappointment this time.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is right across the street from South Coast Plaza. The hotel is not very big, but still lives up to the Starwood Hotels reputation. The rooms are clean with the typical hotel amenities. I also love the Heavenly bed. The hotel does have its own restaurant and bar, but we just went to South Coast Plaza for food.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel was nice and expected to be nice since it was a Westin.  The location is quite and in a serene area.  The bathroom was a little 'shabby' compared to other Westin's I've stayed in but the beds and TV were as expected.  I would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: There was an issue with my reservation but the front desk team of Kory and Sophia worked together to efficiently remedy the situation.  I was provided a great room in record time and even offered a bottle of water for my wait.  They both were fantastic!  I‚Äôve stayed at this hotel numerous times for business and recommend it.  The staff is always extremely professional and helpful (they remember your name),  the rooms are very comfortable and the location is convenient to the Orange County airport as well as a great shopping/dining center- South Coast Plaza (you can just walk across the street).

Summary: Ended up at the Westin due to a reservations screw up at the Wyndham which threatened to ruin our weekend get away. I arrived very tired and in a foul mood. Joyce at the front desk was very courteous and kind. I was quickly checked in to a clean and comfortable room. Later that evening, my husband and I wanted to play pool. Doug, one of the staffers in the lobby, not only suggested several places, he also arranged a ride for free. I cannot say enough nice things about the staff here. We are had a great time.
Manager Response: none

Summary: A typical Westin in every way (which is a good thing), this 1970s-vintage building has been kept beautifully updated. Rooms are spacious and pleasantly decorated in muted, contemporary colors. There's nothing extraordinary about them, but they're extremely comfortable, with the usual excellent Westin bedding. Housekeeping is exemplary and the front desk is friendly. Public spaces like the lobby and even the hallways are also notably spacious; the hotel feels roomy all around. Located in a mixed-use complex that includes the vast Orange County Center for the Performing Arts as well as office buildings, the Westin strikes an effective balance between "businessy" and a place you might want to spend a leisurely weekend. Our check-in and check-out were unusually fast and perfectly
Manager Response: none

Summary: This Westin served as the foundation for an incredibly memorable family vacation for my wife, two daughters, and me.  The property was exceptionally well managed and extremely well located.  Ten minutes to Newport Beach, 25 to Knotts Berry Farm, and a two minute walk to great shopping and dining.  That being said.... the beds were so comfortable we would have been more than happy to stay in our room for a couple of days.  The accommodating staff added to a most relaxing ambiance.  Weaknesses?  For us, there weren't any that negatively impacted our stay (other than the $20 a day parking).  For some families, it may be a bit of a turn off that the pool and dining appear to be more oriented to the business traveler.  Property summary - one of the best high end, dollar for dollar,

Summary Heading: Review of Lobby Lounge bar/lounge only
Summary: I frequent Airport hotel bars and this one ranks right up there.  There is a fantastic indoor waterfall with comfortable couch and chair seating.  The sound of the watefall is soothing and relaxing.  A great place to chill out.  The main lobby has a lounge area also that is nice.  When I was there the bartenders were Ashley and Jose. Ashley is easy on the eyes and fun to chat with.  Jose as well is a good chat.  Even if you live in the area and not staying at the hotel, it is worth checking out.  Parking in the garage is free if leaving after nine.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed here four times in the past three years.  It is a perfectly nice business hotel that has been around since the 1970's and obviously renovated numerous times over the years.  It feels contemporary in most ways, especially in the public areas.  The rooms are pleasant and fairly roomy.  Nice carpet and window coverings, plus the usual great Westin heavenly bed.  Good size LG flatscreen TV.  No complaints there.  The front desk was very pleasant at check-in whenever I stayed here. Great location across from the best mall I have ever been to (and to which it is connected by a bridge).  So, why only three stars?  Here goes:  1) The bathrooms are what gives the hotel's age away.  Although renovated, they are very tight, and the owners skimped on the tiles in the shower.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: We loved it and we'll be back!
Summary: My boyfriend and I had a wonderful stay at the beautiful Westin, South Coast Plaza! I also brought along my dog... as a courtesy guest! We have stayed in many nice places, but this one was especially memorable.... I love the fantastic waterfall that graces the patio and can be seen from inside the lobby. Everyone at the hotel was extremely friendly, courteous and most helpful. Our room was lovely, large and nicely furnished with a beautiful park view.   Another high point was eating in their first class French Restaurant on site...delicious! From the manager, Joyce to all the staff a warm Thank You!  We look forward to our next stay later this month.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed at the Westin South Coast Plaza from 7/5 to 7/8/2011 on a business trip - was just in for all-day meetings - and found myself continually amazed by the ambiance, accessibility, decor and most importantly, the staff.   After a grueling 6-hour flight to Orange County, I spent the entire day working to try and pull together content for a major presentation we had the next day.  In my haste to get things done, I wasn't able to purchase water or toiletries from a local store, and so headed down to the lobby around 10:30pm.  Though the coffee shop / gift shop was closed, Joyce was kind enough to give me a few free water bottles and even tried to scrounge up some basic toiletries for my stay - even canvassing the other employees for help!  Service like this is so rare these

Summary Heading: eewwww.  Stay at Quality Inn instead.  That's the experience.
Summary: I waited 20 minutes to check in with no one in front of me in line. My shower had moldy and cracked tile (room 1503). It's also in severe need of updating.   Parking is an OUTRAGEOUS $20. This is a Quality Inn experience at a Westin price. I should mention that I am a platinum Starwood guest.  I know what I should expect, and my room was supposedly upgraded.

Summary: The Westin gives incredible service!  The front desk employees remember my name and welcome me back with every visit!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you so much for your feedback regarding how you felt when staying at the hotel.  It is great to hear that our associates are recognizing you by name when you stay each time.  Look forward to seein you on your next visit.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary Heading: Still a Westin, but not what I remembered
Summary: I'm a business traveller that spends over 200 nights in hotels a year so I've seen it all.  Keep that in mind when reading my reviews.  THE GOOD I used to stay here a lot for business, but I haven't stayed at this property in almost 6 years.  Upon coming back to OC for a wedding there wasn't a question where I'd stay.  Check-in was what I would expect from a Westin and the valet was friendly.  They upgraded me to a king on the top floor.  The bed was standard heavenly and the room and bathroom itself was clean.  THE BAD The only thing I would say is that the hotel seemed a bit worn down for a Westin.  Probably could use an update soon and some new carpet.  The carpet in the room was rough and stained in some spots.  Not enough convenient electrical plugs which is definitely a
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your feedback.  We strive to deliver experiences for our guest that are memorable. We will continue to look into ways to improve the services we provide to the expert traveler like yourself.  Thank you.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary Heading: first class service and amenities and will definitely recommend to friends
Summary: our stay was made more rewarding with the pleasant demeanor of joyce chu who provided me and my wife excellent service. it is the attitude of employees like joyce that really deserve commendation.

Summary Heading: Good business hotel for lone visitor
Summary: Whilst it carries the Westin name it lacks the finish of a number of Westin's I've stayed in.
