I was moved to another room immediately without fuss. I asked for a park view delux and was therefore away from the noise of the freeway as noted by other reviewers.  This was a moot point as the air conditioning was the loudest I‚Äôve ever experienced in a hotel except in a third world hotel. I preferred to sweat rather than be kept awake by it. The room was nice enough but some of the furnishing looked a little tired. Batch was cracked and the bathroom looked ok but in need
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for your gift of feedback.  We appreciate you letting us know how we can improve.  We understand how important it is to be able to be at your best when traveling and resting.  We have informed the appropriate managers of you experience with the A/C and furnishings.  We will continue to work on improving our product for all guests experiences.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary Heading: Ok, but seems to have gone downhill a bit
Summary: We stayed at the Westin South Coast Plaza a few years ago when we were in OC for a wedding.  I had very fond memories of the place, so we decided to book again when we came for a graduation at UCI.    Overall, we had a decent experience again, but there are a few downsides.  First, the positives.  The location is great.  You can connect to the wonderful South Coast Plaza, via footbridge.  You have great shopping options and tons of restaurants to choose from.  Also, it is conveniently located right off the 405 and only a few miles to Newport Beach.  The pool area is beautiful and the gym is still in pretty good shape.  The hotel rooms are becoming a little dated, although ours was still pretty clean.  Now, the negative.  There was only one, but this was a major negative in my
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for your comments.  Our hotel is centrally located and allows our guests to reach convenient locations in walking distance.  I am glad to hear that this made a difference during your stay.  We appreciate you letting us know about your concerns with the noise in the guest rooms.  We want each of our guests to be able to unwind each night without distractions.  Thank you.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary: I have been at this hotel for the last 6 months as a business and leisure traveller and can not begin to describe the level of personalized ambiance...  Staff such as Joyce in the front desk and Cooper in Valet, continue to WOW me!   The outdoor heated pool and waterfall outdoor dining feature are a retreat for me! Its Magical...  Thanks Westin for making this my home away from home!  -Vishal S.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, thank you so much for informing us that you felt we made you feel special during your six month period of visiting our hotel.  We have recognized Joyce and Cooper for your feedback and we look forward to seeing you on your next visit.  Guest Services Manager.

Summary: Double size bed is downgrading the comfort of heaven bed. I barely could sleep just couldn't find the right position to sleep with my husband in their double size bed. I asked the front desk to arrange me a king size with a sofa pull out. He just simply said no availability without looking into the system.Internet charge in everywhere in the hotel, even though there is charge in the office center, $5/10 min.Self parking is $20/nite, valet is $28/nite. It is extremely close to south coast plaza where is just across the bridge by walking.Reserving this hotel because there is Spa service in the amenities in their web site, there is actually only fitness facility. It's not worth as 4 stars hotel and resort. The room is not sound proof well, easily hear people chatting from the
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We truly appreciate your feedback regarding to your stay.  I apologize that you felt the staff did not achknowledge your concern appropriately.  We will communicate your feedback to our team so they can understand how you felt.  We hope that you will give us another opportunity to exceed your expectations.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary Heading: The friendliest and most accommodating service
Summary: I stayed with my colleagues at the Westin 4 nights a week for the better of 13 weeks (from January to April 2011).  The Bell Captains, Mike and Doug, as well as the valet staff, Anthony and others, were all exemplary in attitude and service.  The nature of this business trip was very very stressful, and each of these Westin employees made me feel at home and cared about.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for your positive feedback regarding to our Westin employees.  We will make sure to share your comments on how they made you feel.  We look forward to seeing you on your return visit.  We hope it may be a more leisure one for you.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary Heading: Good hotel... but they get you with hidden charges
Summary: Room was nice with comfy bed. Window didn't shut tight overlooking pool so wind and traffic created some noise... but that was okay. Despite other guests complaining and "management" being "appreciative of the feedback", the $20 a night parking still exists. In fact, if you leave early in the morning you wouldn't even have to pay since the deck next to the hotel is daily parking by the hour. They are totally ripping guests off with this fee. A bottle of water is $5.50... they are still charging $12.00 for internet even though this should be just as standard as cable (I'm surprised they don't make you pay for a shower and TV use).   Also, the staff at the front were very helpful although the dinner recommendation was terrible. They recommended a Hawaiian themed chain restaurant
Manager Response: none

Summary: I enjoyed my recent 2-night stay.  My room was comfortable, had a flat screen tv, wi-fi internet, and a Heavenly Bed!  The restaurant in the hotel, Pinot, is wonderful for breakfast, lunch, or dinner.  It far exceeds the quality of most hotel restaurants.  The work-out room overlooks the full-size pool.  It is a beautiful facility.  I didn't use the pool but I saw someone swimming laps.  Great stay, I recommend this hotel.  The staff people I interacted with were great.  Located near a fabulous shopping mall, minutes from Disneyland and cultural venues.  Also near most Irvine businesses.  I recommend this hotel -- no complaints.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Recently stayed at the Westin South Coast Plaza for a weekend.  Location was good with convenient access to the 405 and also a pedestrian bridge over to South Coast Plaza.  Hotel rooms appear to have been refurbished within the last few years.  If you are sensitive to traffic noise, request a room on the north side of the hotel.  Only three negatives... 1. $20 parking at an 'out of town' location with ample parking is a bit much. 2. The shower head was too low for a 6'1" person 3. A bottle of water in the room will cost you $5.50
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We enjoy the gift of feedback.  Thank you for letting us know how we can better serve you in the future.  We look forward to having you return so we can provide a wonderful Westin experience.   Guest Service Manager

Summary: Recently stayed for business and I was very satisfied.  Room was very nice and clean with modern furniture and amenities.  Fitness center was great.  Lots of places to eat cuz it's across from South Coast Plaza.  Only knock is the $20 parking fee (valet is even more) and the internet fee.  There's lots of places around here that are more affordable, but if you don't mind spending a little bit more, I would definitely recommend this place.  Lives up to the Westin name.
Manager Response: Dear satisfied guest,  It is a delight to hear that you felt our hotel lived up to the Westin experience.  We strive to service our guests with the best service possible and provide a renewed visit.  We hope you will come back for a return visit.   Guest Service Manager.

Summary: I've stayed here a few times now, and would give this hotel 4.5 stars for the rooms facing away from the freeway and 3.5 stars for the rooms facing the freeway.  The best thing I can say about this hotel is that it's next to a very big mall.  If that's a positive thing for you, then you'll be happy.  If not, the location is not that great.  It's close to the freeway and to the airport in Santa Ana - but the freeway noise is pretty bad in half of the rooms (bad enough that you can sometimes identify particularly noisy trucks).  I did particularly like their airport shuttle service, though.  The rooms are fine - comfortable enough, clean enough, spacious enough, uninspired.  Same for room service - good enough, but not great.  Same for service. (Really - at 2pm on a weekday, they
Manager Response: Dear valued guest,  Thank you for informing us of the amenities that you feel will help our guests feel more valued.  We take pride in our hotel and want all of our guests to feel at their best and be able to reach their potential.   Guest Service Manager.

Summary: I normally stay at the Springhill Suites while traveling on business, but due to illness, I stayed over the weekend and opted for the Westin.  What a bed!  Nothing compares, and room service, while like other room service, i.e. pricey, offered variety with outstanding service.  Hate the parking, in a garage across from the hotel.  Wouldn't stay for business because you must pay for Internet and when I'm on the go for business, I don't want to spend an extra 10 minutes down the elevator, across the street, up the elevator, to my car.  But if you're looking for a very comfortable room and you want a great night's sleep, I highly recommend the Westin.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  A great night sleep is so important.  Our Heavenly Bed experience is one of Westin's most innovative products.  Thank you for letting us know that we were able to help you achieve a truly renewed experience. Guest Service Manager

Summary: That this hotel received positive reviews at all is, alas, attributable more to the limited expectations and lack of refined tastes of the reviewers than it is the quality of the property. (For me, it also highlights the danger of relying too heavily on Internet reviews when making reservations.) This hotel is simply awful. It faces the freeway and a parking lot. It is located in a nondescript 1980s tower that is better suited to the former Soviet Union. Its hallways remind me of a housing project. Its elevator interiors are scarred by years of use without refurbishment. Its rooms are satisfactory, but not more. Even my room's "business desk" is dysfunctional with no visible place to plug in electrical items. Its staff appears haggard and unexcited. And all this at $340 per
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  My sincere apologies that we were unable to meet your expectations.  Our goal at Westin is to provide memorable experiences for our guests.  We will take your feedback and share with our teams to make sure that we deliver on that promise consistently.   Guest Service Manager.

Summary: Booked this hotel last minute on LABOR DAY weekend because i really wanted to go to California for the first time and see the beach, we  stayed two nights for $99.00 a night for a regular room. It was FANTASTIC, the room was EXCELLENT and CLEAN. The service was amazing and they are dog friendly which was an added bonus as I wanted to take my dog with me and they did not charge anything extra. The pool and gym were superb as well as their bar area. The parking was $10 a day and was a block over from the hotel which they actually took care of. I would and I will be staying here again when I go back to CA this Summer.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you so much for letting us know how you felt the hotel and staff made you feel.  It is great to know that we delivered on your needs.  We know how important it is to be able to travel with your dog.  This is why Westin is dog friendly and we help our guests be connected with their animals when traveling.  We look forward to seeing you again.   Guest Service Manager.

Summary: I stayed here for a few nights on a business trip. The hotel is in a great location and the staff was so friendly and accommodating. The room was very comfortable, nicely decorated, and I slept great! The pool area was very nice and it was great to be in the warm sun. The grab and go was convenient for a fast breakfast or lunch. They also had a bar and great restaurant. The hotel is easily located within walking distance to The South Coast Plaza Mall where there is fabulous shopping and some of the best restaurants I have been too. The complimentary shuttle back to the airport was also a nice feature. If you stay here I don't think you will be disappointed.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for your kind review on your experience at our hotel.  We are excited to hear that we were able to help you reach your potential when staying with us.  We look forward to seeing you on your next visit.  Guest Relations Manager.

Summary: It was our first time at the Westin and based on some reviews and their name, we knew we could expect for a nice stay. The room was VERY CLEAN, including the whole bathroom!!! I always travel with a cleaning kit with myself , did my own test and the room was crystal clean!!!  The beds are a dream to sleep in, our daughter did not wanted to get out of the bed and even my husband talked about the confortable bedding set (  we have at home nice ones too, but he noticed the difference). Also, our daughter is very sensitive to cheap cleaning washing detergents, at the Westin, she did not have any breakouts! Their shower heads are a treat  for your morning wake-up call and also for you end-of-the-day relaxation!!! LOVED,LOVED this place.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Traveled to Costa Mesa with co-workers to attend a nursing conference that was to be held at the Westin.  The $200 plus nightly rate gave me pause, but the convenience of staying in the same location as the conference certainly made the price worth it. Check in was a breeze. Check in time is 3 pm-we arrived at 10 am and were quickly checked in with no fuss at all about the early check in. We also inquired about late check out on our departure date-again, no problem at all. Cory was behind the desk and was friendly and efficient. Our rooms were nice and spacious. Mine overlooked the beautiful pool and waterfall/garden area of the hotel.  It was very quiet. The beds! The best hotel bed I've ever slept on!  I was also impressed with the hotel conference area. The conference rooms
Manager Response: none

Summary: The room was very spacious, beds were comfortable.  Nice views.  Had drinks in the lobby bar, and was very nice place to sit.  Loved the lotion and the scent throughout the hotel.  Great views!!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Joyce at the Front Desk Made My Entire Trip
Summary: She really went out of her way to work with me to make my trip very comfortable
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  We truly appreciate your feedback regarding your experience at The Westin South Coast Plaza Hotel.  We are so delighted to hear that Joyce, our Front Desk Associate, was able to make a personal connection with you when you stayed at our hotel.  We will make sure she is made aware of how she made you feel.  We look forward to seeing you again.   Sincerely, Guest Relations Manager.

Summary Heading: Couldnt have started the year better
Summary: My friends and i stayed here over the NYE. This hotel deserves the reputation it has of being number two. We stay at starwood hotels often and were happy with the service we got. Everytime we needed something it was delivered to us in a timely and efficient manner. Only downside? too cold to go swiming but not their fault! Maybe next year they can throw a huge party like the hilton down the street did but nonetheless we were satisfied.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed at the Westin many times over the past 5 year and have usually been pleased with the room and the service. However, this trip was quite different. Our room was not stocked with coffee/tea or bathroom amenities. There was no complimentary water, we found long dark hairs in the bed sheets, a wet washcloth over the tub and long hair on the floor of the bathroom. Surprisingly, the front desk staff had little to say about our situation, did not offer a remedy nor any complimentary services.  I expect more of a hotel that markets itself as a first class business hotel. In fact, I expect the staff to fall all over themselves to make sure their customers are satisfied. Will not stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   Thank you for taking the time to provide us with your feedback from your most recent stay. We regret to hear that your last experience with us was not the most renewing. We will share this feedback with our entire team to ensure we better our service and property to the standards we take pride in.   We sincerely hope we will have another chance to accommodate you during your next visit to Costa Mesa.   Sincerely,  The Westin South Coast Plaza Management.

Summary: I have been staying at this hotel for a year. Joyce Chu has been very helpful the las couple of times I checked in going out of her way to make sure the hotel could accommodate my change in travel plans. K
Manager Response: none

Summary: We booked 4 rooms, and they honored our request to have all the rooms on the same floor.  The landscaping and pool area of this hotel is very nice.  The rooms are good sized with a flat panel TV.  They allow pets, which is why I think one of our rooms had a weird smell, but they fixed that problem by spraying something onto the carpet.  Other than that, our stay there was great.  Parking did cost $20 per day, and it was detached from the building, making it inconvenient to walk such a long way from the parking lot to the room.   They do have valet parking available.  If you skip house cleaning, they'll give a $5 pass for use at the coffee shop.  Also, this hotel has a nice walk bridge to the South Coast Plaza mall.  Overall, we all liked staying here and would go back again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,   We are delighted to hear that you had enjoyed your stay with us. We hope you had a wonderful time at the South Coast Plaza Mall and we hope to see you and your families back with us soon.  Happy New Years.   Westin South Coast Plaza Management.

Summary Heading: Nice, but we will pass next time.
Summary: The Westin South Coast is a clean business hotel with good service. But, this bland, sterile and corporate property is out of place in California and is more befitting of downtown Houston. ¬†Naked trees and the absence of any real landscaping makes this place about as inviting as a Kansas City office park in the dead of winter! ¬†With that understood, the hotel serves it's purpose and is staffed with courteous professionals.  Unfortunately, I was really put off by the breakfast service in the on-site restaurant. ¬†A buffet would have been nice; however, I can understand that is may not be cost effective during the week at all hotels. ¬†My complaint is the fact that refills on orange juice are five dollars per glass. ¬†This is totally unacceptable when a decent American breakfast
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  We apologize for the experience you had at our hotel and thank you for the gift of feedback. We are committed in taking all the necessary steps in improving our operation and service so that we may provide our guest with a renewing experience.   We hope to have the opportunity in the future to provide you with an inspiring experience here at the Westin.   Sincerely,  Hotel Management

Summary: For a hotel that sits in the heart of swanky Orange County and is surrounded by corporate headquarters and high-end restaurants, is close to fancy Newport Beach and is adjacent to the upscale South Coast Plaza Shopping Mall, you might expect a more refined hotel.   Westins can be a crap shoot, as they range from old and dated like Indianapolis or any of the Toronto properties, to name a few, to super nice like the Times Square or Ft.Lauderdale locations. Consistency is not their strong point.  The modern exterior with manicured gardens, the busy valet area, complete with pricey cars, the bar and lounge area with sexy bartenders, a dramatic courtyard and waterfall and the very good Pinot Provence restaurant all belie the dated rooms and tired hall interiors.   I'm a Starwood
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   Thank you for taking the time to share your feedbacks with us. We appreciate all the words of encouragement you have for us and also the areas of opportunities we have to improve.   We are very honored to be hosting your frequent stays in the Orange County area and we hope to continue to make your experience renewing. We will take your gifts of feedbacks to continue to improve our facility.   We hope you had a great New Years celebration and hope to see you soon.   Sincerely,  Westin South Coast Plaza Management

Summary Heading: Very Poor Service - Worst Stay EVER
Summary: I read these reviews and have no idea how this hotel can get such high reviews.  I got the awesome rate of $99 a night during SPG latest prepaid special.  I walk in and as they look at my reservation they tell me that no one flagged my reservation as Platinum so no upgraded rooms were available.  Ok fine, I just want to lay down after driving almost 5 hours from Vegas.  Then the guy tells me in a loud voice that my credit card has been declined and my room not confirmed.  I was like WHAT, first of all why announce that to the whole registration area, and secondly he was dead wrong!  I called Amex and they never even attempted to charge my credit card until he did.  He also made some other claims about my reservation that just weren't true but I just wanted to go.  As he hands me
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   We apologize for the experiences you had with us during your recent visit to Orange County. We regret to hear that the experience was less than renewing. We have taken your feedback to share it with our team to identify the areas of opportunities we have to improve.   We appreciate your loyalty to Starwood and hope we will have another opportunity to provide you with the experiences you expect and deserve.   Sincerely,   Westin South Coast Plaza Management

Summary: This is not a luxury hotel, this is a downtown property which caters to business travelers. It was clean and the rooms were nicely appointed. The restaurant was great and the overall service was good. It was exacltly as I had expected.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   Thank you for your recent stay with us. We are delighted we were able to deliver the experiences you had expected and deserve.   We hope to see you soon and to provide you with the renewing experiences that you are accustomed to.   Happy New Years!  Westin South Coast Plaza Management

Summary: The room was no different than the rooms at The Westin at the LA Airport, and those rooms are better. In case you didn't know, the LAX Westin is a category 2! I definitely expected better, this hotel is NOT a category 4. There was a slight scent to the hotel and rooms, not much. The bathroom tiling was brown and or discolored. There was no turn down service. The restaurant prices for breakfast were definitely too high, category 6 prices. I just expected more for a category 4 Westin property. Would I stay again? Yes. Now I just know what not to expect. I'm still an SPG fan.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   Thank you for taking the time to share your feedbacks with us. We thank you for your loyalty to the Starwood Properties and the Westin brand.   We regret to hear that some areas of your stay were less than satisfying. We are dedicated to continue to improve our facility to continue to provide our guests with a refreshing stay.   We hope to see you again on your next visit to the Costa Mesa area.   Sincerely,   Westin South Coast Plaza Management

Summary Heading: updated building, but still feels a little old.
Summary: I stayed at the Westin for a quick wedding weekend in Huntington Beach.  I booked our room through hotels.com and got a good price.  Our room had a king bed and was adequately furnished.  The only real negative I found with this hotel is that our room (while being updated) still had an old and outdated feeling to it.  The bathroom had signs of wear on the edges and shower and toilet which made it feel kind of dirty (even though I knew it was all clean).  The staff was very friendly.  We did not get a chance to use the pool or any other amenities they had to offer, but I'm sure it would've been fine.  Parking was easy (although you do have to pay for the garage next door) and it was just a short walk from the garage to hotel lobby.  Overall, I'm glad I got a good deal for the
Manager Response: none

Summary: I love this hotel.  The rooms are nice and clean.  The staff is very friendly.  The only downside is that parking is expensive.  I believe parking was $18.  Otherwise, I would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A gem in an oasys of strip malls
Summary: Been staying here for two years now on regular business trips.  Far from any quaint neighborhoods, it  offers the sought-after heavenly beds with exquisite customer service that makes this place feel like home away from home.  Sokarn and Luke are a welcome sight at the front desk deftly familiar with every nuances of each guest.    Ashley and Jose are very capable behind the bar.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have had reservations regarding this hotel. However, after my last few trips I am happy to say that its all in the past.  Rooms - Easily the best in the area Location - Walking distance from great food and shopping Service - Amazing!  In particular, Sokarn makes the hotel experience; keeping my reservations in line and making me feel right at home. As long as she's working I would recommend this hotel to anyone.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel is located near South Coast Plaza, there is a bridge in front of the hotel that will lead you to the shopping mall across the street. We had a great time there.   The bed is comfy and the staffs are very friendly. They also have Strucbucks coffee in the room which is great. I just think the hotel seem to be so quiet when compared with the nearby Hilton. Parking can be a bit hassle. My husband had to park the car at residential area and then he walked back to meet us at the hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Excellent Business Hotel, Well Located with Great Restaurants!
Summary: My husband and I have stayed several times at this lovely Westin, and we are never disappointed.  The rooms are lovely, and large, with all the amenities we look for from a Westin.  Comfy beds, well appointed bathrooms, and great service.  Beign located adjacent to the sprawling South Coast Plaza, this is also a great destination for shoppers, although we do not usually have time for shopping on our business trips.  The South Coast Repertory Theatre is just steps away from this hotel, which makes it convenient for us doing our work (we are in the theatre).  The restaurant in the hotel, Pinot Provence, is beautifully decorated, and serves lovely breakfasts, lunches and dinners, all delicious and professionally served.  Also, next door is Scot's Seafood Restaurant, which offers a
Manager Response: none

Summary: While the Westin Costa Mesa is a fine, solid, "average" hotel, it certainly does not meet the criteria for a four-star property.  I stayed here often in the 1980s and it appears little has changed. The property has a dated feel. Front desk staff were less than perfect. Seemed more interested in "poses" than in any actual help to guests.  I actually found the janitorial/gardening folks the most helpful and they were forgiving of my "high school" Spanish.  Especially irritating is that this hotel mimics the nearby Hilton, charging you for internet access in your room, as well as changing you for internet access in the hotel business center. However, you can print airline boarding passes for free.  The attached restaurant did have a wonderful breakfast, however for prices hovering
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  We apologize for the experience you had at our hotel and thank you for the gift of feedback. We are committed in taking all the necessary steps in improving our operation and service so that we may provide our guest with a renewing experience.   We hope to have the opportunity in the future to provide you with an inspiring experience here at the Westin.   Sincerely,  Hotel Management

Summary: We stayed here after making several hurried calls to locate a room.  The 800 service waqs on top of things and had us in in no time. When we checked in its obivious to Itzel we desperatly needed sleep.  She was cherrful, supportive and fast.  The following morning we were suprised to find her again at the front desk.  Still cherry and helpful.  The room service people were helpful as well and expeditded our food.  In the am valet was equally cherry and helpful.  We have stayed at other Westin properties with similar experiences, but this one reall stood out.  Being in the customer service industry we are often acutly aware of disingenious service.  This property really raises the bar.  Scott & Sue Pascoe
Manager Response: Dear Mr. & Mrs. Pascoe,  Thank you for your great comment! We are inspired to hear that Itzel was able to provide you with a cheerful and renewing experience! We hope you had a wonderful time in Costa Mesa and we hope to see you soon.  Sincerely, Hotel Management

Summary Heading: A HUGE fan of the Westin brand, but this hotel did not live up to the rest
Summary: I've been to many Westin hotels in the US and abroad, and I always extremely impressed. Because of that, I have high expectations when staying at a Westin property. Other than a nice lobby, this hotel has very little to offer. Service was not up to the Westin standard (in my opinion, but other reviewers seems to feel otherwise). Both when I called the day before to confirm my reservation and when I called from the room to request a wake-up call, the phone rang 10+ times before someone picked up. And not that it's a huge deal, but usually when I call from a hotel room, the person on the other line answers "Hello Mr. ____, how can I help you?". All I got this time after many rings was a confused "Hello?". The hotel overall is very worn (I highly doubt this was built as a Westin; I
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  We apologize for the experience you had at our property. We appreciate all your comments and feedback and will look into each of the areas of opportunities you have mentioned. We are committed to learn from our guests and to improve our current processes with these gifts of feedback.   We hope you will give us another opportunity to provide you with the Westin Experience you expect and deserves.     Sincerely, Hotel Management.

Summary Heading: Felt like a resort, but we hadn't left the city
Summary: We live in LA and found this hotel through the Starwood Preferred website - because of our membership, we stayed on the top floor in a very nice, fairly spacious room.  They had a special package entitled "Drive and Dine" which got us the hotel for around $135 a night, plus a $50 rebate toward our gas expenses and assorted other perks.  The hotel is beautiful, truly resort-feeling, well-located near some wonderful restaurants, the Performing Arts Center, and of course South Coast Plaza.  Not too far from Laguna Beach and the coast.  The main restaurant in the hotel, Pinot Provence, was good but not great, not worth the money - I'd eat instead at Marche Moderne at South Coast Plaza, truly one of the finest French bistros I've ever been to (and that includes Paris).  But we had a
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   Thank you for your feedback! We are glad to hear you had such a wonderful experience at our property, but we were disheartened to hear that Pinot Provence did not live up to your expectations.  As the holiday season approaches, there are many great performances scheduled for the Performing Arts Center! We hope to see you back soon in Costa Mesa!    Sincerely,  Hotel  Management

Summary: As a top-tier elite at another hotel chain, I've been staying in sub-par properties for a long time without knowing it, since I had nothing to compare against.  I attended a meeting at a Westin recently and was impressed with the friendliness of the staff.  So I had Starwood match my status.  So far so good!  Rooms are a cut above and the staff are more than friendly.  Many businesses don't realize that customer intimacy = customer loyalty.  I was greeted by Sokarn at the front desk and was given an upgrade and a late checkout the next day.  Westin definitely puts their front desk folks through a lot of training, and they seem happy with their jobs.  I whole-heartedly recommend The Westin SCP to business travelers.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your valuable comments! We are enthralled to hear about your experience. We are also delighted to hear that Sokarn was able to provide you with a renewing experience!   We hope to see you soon and to be your home away from home!  Hotel Management.

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay at Westin South Coast Plaza
Summary: I really enjoyed my Labor Day weekend stay at the Westin South Coast Plaza.  The service was great.  The roof top swimming pool and fitness center were great too.  Also, it was conveniently located 15 minutes from Disneyland and the shopping mall is across the street.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  We are glad to hear about your wonderful experience with us! We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed our facilities. We hope you had fabulous time at Disneyland and the South Coast Plaza.  We hope to see you and your family soon during the holidays.  Sincerely, Hotel Management

Summary: I was a bit apprehensive about the Westin after reading earlier reviews, but this is a great stay. Admittedly, we stayed here to visit South Coast Plaza, so the location was perfect, but we were pleasantly surprised by the hotel.  If you are here to shop, you can't do better. Stroll across the walkway & you're at one of the best malls in the world. But the Westin is a nice destination in itself. Firm beds, rooms are reasonably spacious, spotlessly clean, and terrific service. I am reasonably critical, as my reviews would reveal, but I loved it here. The concierge is particularly helpful. Well done, Westin South Coast Plaza.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  We are delighted to hear about your great experience with us! We are also excited to hear you had such a great time at the South Coast Plaza Mall!  We look forward to providing you with more memorable experiences.   Westin South Coast Plaza Management.

Summary: I stayed at the Westing Costa Mesa Hotel last week and had such a great experience!  Every one was so helpful and friendly, especially the front desk staff.  In particular Sokarn provided exceptional service and went beyond her duties to make my stay pleasurable.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your wonderful comments! We are delighted to hear that one of our staff was able to provide you with an renewing experience!  We appreciate your gift of feedback and will continue to strive to provide you with the same inspiring experience.  Westin South Coast Plaza Management

Summary: We stayed at the Westin on the last night of our 7 day trip to California.  I got the Westin through Hotwire.  Due to our plans for that day, Levi, the young man at the front desk, pre-registered us and told us our rooms would be ready upon our return.  He was very pleasant and helpful.  Upon our return, our rooms were ready as promised.  He had put us in connecting rooms.  It was great!  Although we loved our previous six days at the Hilton, having connecting rooms on the last day of our trip allowed us to discuss and enjoy our trip together at the end of the day. The beds were heavenly!  Our rooms overlooked the pool and waterfall.  It is especially beautiful at night.  Down in the lobby, an elderly gentleman was softly playing the piano.  Unlike the Hilton, the garage is not
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, but way too much noise
Summary: After staying here 5 times in the last year, I think I've just finished my last stay.  In April the restaurant next door (Scott's) held a party with dance music until at least 1 am.  I could not sleep, and the front desk said they could not do anything.  They told me they already moved one guest - and it didn't help, so it would not help to move me.  They said they have this problem with the restaurant and have asked them to stop but apparently they don't.  They refused to call the police - said that they could not call because the hotel was a business- I never really understood the explanation.  Maybe they expected their guests to call?  This time (july 2010), it was not the restaurant, but the outdoor cleaning which starts at 05:00 in the morning somewhere in the neighborhood
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   We apologize for the experience you recently had at our hotel and thank you for your feedback. We are committed to taking all the necessary steps to correct the issues you have brought to our attention.  We hope you will give us another opportunity to deliver to you the renewing experience you expect and deserve from the Westin.  Sincerely,   Hotel Management

Summary: This hotel has one of the best locations in the area. Walking distance to the mall, and centrally located in Orange County.   Hotel needs some updating in the rooms and the lobby could use some upgrading as well.   Service was good, but not exceptional.
Manager Response: Dear valued guest,  I am delighted to hear that you felt our location was conveniently located to your desired destinations.  The hotel was renovated a couple years ago and we will continue to enhance the property to better serve our guests.  Thank you for your feedback.  Sincerely, Management.

Summary: I came out for an extended weekend with my husband . I was delighted with my experience. The hotel rooms were spacious and very clean the heavenly beds and showers meet their description. I had an excellent view of Orange county and the large pool. The fitness center was also impressive. The coffee makers were restocked and offered very tasty coffee not some cheap coffee. Most of all the staff was really nice and a gentleman was nice enough to bring me a sewing kit when I needed a safety pin. Its a great hotel to stay in especially because I didn't hear any noise in the hallways or receive any disturbances. Thanks again Westin and all your wonderful staff hope to see you next time I am in California !
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you so much for your kind words regarding our staff.  I know our team will appreciate hearing that they made an impact on your experience with us.  We look forward to making many more memorable experiences for you when you stay at our hotel.  Sincerely, Management.

Summary Heading: A great deal, wouldn't have paid full price
Summary: For our $79 deal of Hotwire.com, this was a great steal, as were flying into Long Beach at 7pm and leaving for Dana Point early the next morning. The rooms were nice and the service was good but not worth the rack rate of $209. We arrived on 7/25 and stayed for 1 night. We were pleased to see that they upgraded us to a Corner room (Rm. 311) for free. About have of the 3rd floor is empty Conference rooms so the floor was pretty quiet. The hotel is older, as you can see signs in the shower, hallways. etc. The beds were very comfortable and we slept well (except for 1 pillow after I learned after the fact). The rooms are modern and look appealing to the eye. Westin Hotels have gone to far with going green. I understand about being eco-friendly and all but cutting down the quality
Manager Response: Dear valued guest,  We thank you for your feedback.  We take pride in our hotel and appreciate receiving your impression of your experience with us.  We are glad to hear you enjoyed the location and felt that our facilities were appealing and that you would return.  We look forward to having you back with us.  Sincerely, Management.

Summary Heading: Gorgeous - a gem of a hotel

After returning from dinner at the nearby South Coast Plaza, we relaxed by the waterfall on the outdoor covered patio with our in-room Starbucks.  Couldn't have asked for a better stay!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  It is great to hear that you had a memorable experience at our hotel.  We look forward to your return visit.  Hotel Management.

Summary Heading: Just love staying at the Westin
Summary: From beginning to end, the trip was just perfect.  I was brought up in Irvine but now live in L.A.  I always try to stay at the Westin when I go the O.C.  The rooms are so plush and beautiful and the staff is extremely courteous.  I've have brought my dog in the past.  They gave him a heavenly bed to sleep on and a water/food dish.  I totally recommend the Westin for anyone who wants to be pampered at a reasonable price.  We sat at the pool all day then enjoyed they're beautiful bar in the evening.  If your driving do have dinner at Javier's at the newport coast and breakfast at Surf & Sand -Splashes restaurant.  Made for a perfect mini vacation.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Our location and guest rooms really do allow for our guests to feel pampered.  It is great to hear that your dog was able to get the same treatment when visiting last time.  Have a renewed day.  Hotel Management.

Summary: This Westin was a comfortable place to stay on a 3-day business trip. Service was a standout--everyone from valet parking to front desk to housekeeping staff was welcoming, helpful and efficient. Pinot Provence, the hotel restaurant, served delicious food for both breakfast and dinner, though at predictably high prices. Room service--even pricier than the restaurant--was prompt and pleasant. The bedroom clean and comfortable, but lacked electrical outlets; I had to unplug a lamp to plug in the iron. Nice touches included a coffee/tea maker with free Starbucks coffee, and a large flat-screen TV with lots of cable channels. Lighting and workspace were both great for working in the room. The bathroom was clean and well-kept, but the lack of towel racks was bothersome. Fresh towels

We thought the management was being on a really cheap side.  Not even complement water nor daily newspaper were available.  watch out for internet fee, $5.50 bottle water...Would definitely not coming back.
